description:
When eating out of the ordinary my tummy enjoys Indian food. Not sure how many people like Indian food but my taste bud was calling for Indian food to recall great memories while traveling through Pakistan and India some sunsets ago! #india #hindu #food #enjoy #pakistan #enjoyinglife #turechai #chai #memories 

This little Indian/Pakistani restauran has good food. They were very attentive and friendly. They created small plates for my small budget and everything was tasteful! Muy come to this place again!
author: Mari L.

description:
A bare bones restaurant that serves delicious  Indian food next to UCSF. You don't go here for the ambience, you go here for the food and friendly faces.

I have eaten there several times and can attest for the naan, veg tikka masala and chicken tikka kebab. Looks like it is family run and they seem to know a lot of their customers.
author: Sunil R.

description:
Freshest meat and ingredients, perfect balance of spices, and most authentic flavor in town. 

My fav go-to is Lamb Saag and whole wheat Tandoori RoTi. 

Also, one of the cleanest kitchens and restrooms of all the Indian/Pakistani restaurants in the area.
author: Rawi M.

description: It's always closed when I want food.  I don't eat my first food (coffee doesn't count) until around 4pm and that's when I'm hungry but this place is closed.  I'm not about to go back out in an hour just to pick up food after I get home, I'd rather not eat at all if I can't pick up food on my way home.  You know, not everyone eats at the prescribed hours, some of us still possess independent thoughts and actions.
author: Kai T.

description:
Thanks for:  

1) The dozen bone fragments in my chicken vindaloo. I'm sure my dentist is quite happy about the future work I will have. 

2) The absurdly diluted mango lassi. How much water do you guys use to cut your yogurt drinks? This has to be at least a 1:2 dilution. 

3) Your dry and boring roti with an essence of basil and garlic. You'll be hearing from La Croix shortly. 



Thank you! Come again!
author: Aren A.

description:
Total paid was $20.08

I walked in to see a white mom and her two kids sitting right by the door. A couple were on a tired date at the table closest to the kitchen and had bountiful feast laying before them. An elder gentleman greeted me and helped me maneuver through the menu to an order of Chicken Tikka Masala, Garlic Sesame Naan, Mango Lassi, and Milk Tea.

Overall rating 9/10:
Atmosphere (lighting, scents): 10/10 Quite on Mon-Thu evenings. No scents. Faint ethnic music
Transparency: 10/10 Kitchen was in full view of patrons (Image 01).
Attitude: 10/10
Crowd: Medical professionals from UC system through lunch hour on weekdays.
Parking: Go-'round-the-block. (I found a spot immediately across the street on a Monday evening).

Food:
Chicken Tikka Masala $9.50 (Main Dish):
Faithfulness to stereotype: 9/10
Cleanliness (Furniture, Silverware): 9/10
Right Temperature: 9/10
Taste (Texture & Consistency factored in): 9/10
Timeliness: 10/10


Garlic Balsamic Sesame Naan ($2.50 without Sesame. $3:49 with) 
Traditional South Asian Bread Variety. Other variety available as Rooti):
Faithfulness to stereotype: 9/10
Cleanliness: 9/10
Right Temperature: 9/10
Taste: 9/10
Timeliness: 10/10

Margo Lassi $3 (Yogurt based mango-pulps beaten to a shake)
Faithfulness to stereotype: 8/10 (Lassi was warmly recommended at this place by others. So it's possible my experience is just an odd one)
Cleanliness: 9/10
Right Temperature: 9/10
Taste: 9/10 (not too sweet and with adequate thiccness)
Timeliness: 10/10

Milk Tea (free!)
Faithfulness to stereotype: 9/10
Cleanliness: 9/10
Right Temperature: 9/10
Taste: 9/10 (Creamy and light. White sugar only)
Timeliness: NA (self-help)

Interruptions or complaints?
None

Visit & review took place on:
8:00pm, Feb 19 2018.
author: Ryan B.

description: Amazing flavors. Have to go. Lamb biriyani with the chutney sauce to die for. Alo ghobi  is tasty and chutney sauce!!
author: June P.

description: Reliable food, it's a solid 3.5/4 Stars.  It's quick, no frills, consistent and the price is right.  The chicken Tikka Masala and okra are great!
author: VM B.

description:
Rude!!! Avoid! Order a garlic naan, potato naan and chicken tandoori Togo. They provided me just one chutney and one plum sauce. I asked for another green sauce and the old man said "No. only 2". I said there's only 1 green sauce. The man continued to say "No only 2". The younger man came and starting saying only one each. Why would a restaurant make a big fuss about a teaspoon of sauce?! 

Aside from the service, the naans were bad. Hardly tasted any garlic and the potato at all. On the other hand, that tiny chicken tandoori was decent but tasted like Lt was reheated.
author: K C.

description: I love this place so much! This food is authentic and delicious. I eat here all the time and I have very discerning tastes and they never disappoint.
author: Kim S.

description:
Located close to the UCSF Medical Center campus, Tikka Masala provides a wide selection of Indian and Pakistani dishes.  It's a moderately sized restaurant, but when my friend and I went for a lunchtime meal, we were able to find an open table easily.  The service was friendly but somewhat impersonal; it also took a few reminders to get my friend's beverage request.

In terms of the food, I thought our entrees were average.  We tried the chicken korma and the saag paneer, and I found both to be lacking in flavor.  Granted, there were not the spiciest dishes on the menu, but both items were more on the bland side.  I did enjoy the sesame naan, which was warm and nicely fluffy.  Tikka Masala would not be on my list of favorite Indian/Pakistani restaurants in San Francisco, but I would consider going back if I was nearby.
author: Keith H.

description: This is one of the only mom n pop restaurants left in San Francisco.  The food is great!  Order at the register, and you will be served.  The tandoori is especially good, as are the tikka masala dishes, and the spinach is freshly made with no added cream.  I love all the daal and chickpea dishes too.  Free chai is available at all times and comes from the pot unsweetened so you can have it without sugar or just add the amount you want.  They are nice people.  Highly recommended!
author: Devon W.

description:
I went here for a quick dinner, and their service was quick. I ordered a chicken tikka masala with naan and it was good. Standard portion for Indian food with self-served milk tea. 

I wish the chicken tikka masala was spicier, because it seemed a little plain compared to the other ones I have tried. Naan is good, not too thick (texture), but on the small side. I believed it was a combination of me being hungry and the dishes on the smaller side that I was able to finish everything very quickly. 

Clean, quiet and efficient, not a bad place to grab a quick lunch or dinner if you are in the area!
author: Karen C.

description:
I don't normally come here for lunch, but today, I had no choice since most of the restaurants nearby are closed for the 4th of July. 
I ordered vegetable biryani and believe me I tried biryani so many time at different restaurants. This biryani I got today was not that good -- sorry, but just being honest. I love Indian food but if you really want a good one, try elsewhere. Come here ONLY when you're in the area and you don't have any other options. Otherwise, go somewhere else. 
Too bad, I would have come again if the food is good since it's only a couple blocks from my office. But, unfortunately, this is not the case.
author: Jasmijn L.

description: Good food, typical Indo-Pakistani, a little it on the spicy side so I saw to make my order mild.  Always clean facilities and friendly service.
author: Kon N.

description: Best food best service n reasonable price. Any time go there always welcome by the staff all smiling faces I wish they can open more hours n Sunday morning
author: Arshad M.

description: I walk into the joint, am acknowledged & then ignored as the staff proceeds to wait on others who came in after me. WTF !!! Needless to say I got up and walked out the door. AVOID.
author: Henry K.

description:
Great place for chicken tikka masala, good naan and good rice.  The owner is super friendly and awesome guy.

If you love Tikka Masala and you're around the Golden Gate Park area, this is a great place for lunch.
author: Ahmad A.

description: This place is above average. If you want flavor go with the vindaloo or korma dishes. The daal is the real deal.  The Judah and 6th location is the best the neighorhood has to offer. It kicks Naan-n-Curry's butt. Ditto for Tasty Curry, which was back in the day. I implore Yelpers to find a better Pakistani and Indian spot in the neighborhood.
author: John G.

description: I order Indian food a lot-- it's my favorite and I've tried many different places in the city. Ordered this for delivery through Grubhub because I wanted to try a new Indian spot. Oh my goodness, do I regret it. This was the worst Indian food I've ever had. I ordered chicken tikka masala and I don't even know of what I got would be considered Tikka masala... it was so bad. The sauce was yellowish and thick and not good. It's supposed to be red/orange. The rice was like regular white rice with no flavor and no spices. This is not real Indian food... and not even fake Indian. It's something else, but not Indian food. Do not try this place.
author: Jessie A.

description: Came here for dinner when desperately craving Indian food, and I thought anything would've done. And yet, despite the voracious appetite, the food was just alright to me. Chicken tikka masala honestly tasted like it had a splash of Campbell's Soup or too much artificial tomato puree in it -- harsh, but it's how I perceived it. Samosa was good. Garlic naan tasted like regular naan. I will likely be trying a different Indian place in the hood next time.
author: Kristina L.

description: This place is a little gem!  Although I am guilty of always ordering the same thing, I really enjoy their chicken tikka masala!  The place is a little on the cozy side, but it is always clean, and the staff are friendly whenever I come in.  Definitely worth checking out when you get tired of the same old thing for lunch!
author: Marisa D.

description: I come here all the time.  Excellent prices, friendly service, and my food is always ready when they say it will be.  I usually order the chicken Tikka Masala and its better here than other places in the neighborhood and much more affordable.  What's not to like?
author: Paul W.

description: Great little blue-collar Indian food restaurant. The chicken tikka-masala was simple and tasty. The rice included spices and some color, and had great flavor and texture. The naan was light and fluffy.  Water and chai were self-serve and free. Service was prompt and friendly, if not warm.   Good food, quaint charm, under $20! I'm glad I dropped in for lunch!
author: Jeff R.

description:
Nothing special. Food is OK but on the bland side and too heavy. I ordered the tikka masala and specifically requested it "medium spicy" which may have been partially to blame for the lack of flavor. We didn't order the menus items we were suggested, I think we should have done that to get better dishes. I might come back for that if the Indian craving comes over me.

The service is friendly and attentive, but no ambiance to speak of. So I'd give it a "meh" which Yelp thinks is two stars, but I think 3 is appropriate... for now.
author: Michelle J.

description:
I love chicken Tiki Masla. I had an opportunity to spend my lunch here and ordered it. I politely asked if you can add extra chicken and he "the waiter" said ok. Waited for my food to come out to find there's hardly any chicken that I ask for. I call him out and ask and his answer was yes, it was included. I asked him, how much do you guys put in? And he replies "I don't know" causing a huge scene.

They got amongst themselves and started talking, I'd bet money they were talking hella sh!t behind my back. I don't ever plan to come here again. I don't mind paying the extra surcharge for meat, but needless to say I expect what I pay for! 

1. They were rude as hell
2. They offer bad customer service
3. If you are looking to fufil your na'an and curry desires, I suggest you look somewhere else.
author: Andrew L.

description:
Friends, there is a reason why I oftentimes preplan the meals during our foodie adventures. Yes, I can be very "particular," and yes, I used a euphemism.

See, tonight, my friend and I had a really difficult time choosing among their meat curry dishes. And that uncomfortable feeling of ambiguity and uncertainty is something I never want to impart on my dining companions.

Friends, my "particularity" is just a way of showing how much I care about you.

Anyhoo, onto the review. We took Mark Y.'s recommendation to get the $6.99 LAMB WRAP, which is a flour tortilla surrounding pulled lamb, lettuce, tomatoes, and cucumber, accompanied by mint&jalapeño chutney and sweet tamarind sauces (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tikka-masala-san-francisco-2?select=-I1hCo5xaZDdhcIzvHCxRA#8luLLKW3VNGEeo8WklNYog). The wrap wasn't overflowing with ingredients but was still filling. The tortilla was toasted for a nice crunchiness, and the lamb was juicy and surprisingly subtle, in a good way. The sauces definitely added an appreciated dimension of flavor, which could explain the toned-down flavor of the lamb meat.

As for the conundrum of our second dish, we took a page out of another reviewer's book and ordered according to the restaurant name: CHICKEN TIKKA MASALA, $8.49 (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tikka-masala-san-francisco-2?select=-I1hCo5xaZDdhcIzvHCxRA#6ZPatkIRY-ALrGLzE9tCwQ). To hear the restaurant describe it, the dish had "tender morsels of boneless chicken breast marinated in a blend of freshly ground herbs, baked over charcoal, then cooked in the chef's special masala sauce." A classic dish that didn't stand out above other chicken tikka masalas I've had at other Indian places. The chicken was neither moist nor strongly seasoned, but the chunks were large, and the sauce was comforting and not too acidic. The $1 NAAN, which is made with wheat, was a tad bit crispier than other places I've been to, but it was doughy enough for adequate sauce-mopping.

Also, it should be noted that for dine-in, you place your order at the cash register, and they bring you the check at the end of your meal. And, while you're up there, turn to your right and grab a cup of free chai tea.

It's not fine dining, but the dining is fine nonetheless. Especially with me ;)

HAHAHA.
author: Adele F.

description:
Food was OK.  The price is quite reasonable.  But other than that I would say this is a good place to have a quick late night after having a couple too many beers... We ordered several dishes but unfortunately everything sort of started to taste the same.  Portions are small but there is a lot of sauce...  Though as I said, prices are reasonable...  
And no, we weren't making a post bar stop, I had granny and the kids with me.  Definitely better than the place on Irving between 7 and 8...  
I would give three stars but the people working were quite nice, so four.
author: Keeping It Real K.

description: We ordered delivery for 20 people last weekend and had a top notch experience with this neighborhood restaurant. The food was great (our guests devoured every morsel), Faisal was amazing (helped us select the menu, helped us set up, and made everything easy, and the price was reasonable. Highly recommended.
author: Molly G.

description: I'd recommend to avoid this place, In fact I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. I experienced waves of racist etiquette from the cashier coupled with remedial service. Modern social standards should be a part of the current restaurants experience but this place lacks almost everything and makes you feel dirty.
author: Denise T.

description: Great food. One of the things we ordered was the chicken tikka masala and buttermilk chicken and it was delicious. But there was a lot of sauce and not to much chicken. Overall I rate it 4/5
author: Angela F.

description: I went in asking for a side of rice to go (the grocery store was out, and I was heading home to make lunch and that was the only item I needed). The employee at the register asked if I had cash and I said yes. Then another employee came up and said "no rice only, this is not a cafeteria". I'm not sure if they understand that today's "rice only" customer (a very simple request, and is an item on their menu with no disclaimer saying it must be purchased with anything else) becomes tomorrow's lunch or dinner customer, but because of the horribly rude service I received I will never return.
author: Christopher N.

description:
The service was amazing. Delivery came really quick! If you want a quick delivery and great Indian food, Tikka Masala is hands down the best in the Sunset.

The other ratings are so wrong. Go once and you'll see why.
author: Julie C.

description: The food is good but it's lacking flavor.. it could be better with small adjustments. I liked the complimentary milk tea though
author: Khaled A.

description: I went to this place three weeks ago and had chicken briyani and tandoori. All recipes were half cooked and chicken briyani smelt like raw chicken in it. Chicken and potato pieces were too big, looked like the cook did not have time to cut them. I could not eat briyani so I called the waiter and told him about it. He took the briyani back and cut the pieces to small and brought it back. I told chicken is half cooked and smells bad. He did not listen to me and told harshly "Everything is cooked properly eat it" :(. He was standing near the billing counter, next to my table, as you know this place is too small and started to stare at me as if I am trying to create trouble. I left the briyani as it was on the table, paid for it and left. The waiter, I think the owner, was happy as he got his money. I would never go back to this place.
author: Devan K.

description:
I've been wanting to go to this place for a while. It's a little off the beaten path so I figured this had to be a diamond in the rough. It sits near the UCSF Hospital so I'm assuming it must get pretty busy during the week around lunch time so that might not be the best time to come here because the place isn't large. It has a nice small cafe feel to to. There's roughly 6-8 tables closely arranged. The menus are easy to read and the aroma inside is mouth watering. When we stepped in we couldn't wait to get our food. 

We orders one order of samosas, lamb, chicken tikka masala, two orders of garlic nann, two orders of rice. I have to say, everything was to my standard. I wish it was a bit more spicy that's all. the sauce on the tikka masala was just delicious. The lamb was nicely done and tasted wonderful. The garlic nann was amazing. This place is highly recommended. $35+tip for two people wasn't a bad deal. I'll definitely make another stop in again sometime soon.
author: Krishna V.

description:
I wish I could say I was writing a review on the food, but I never got the chance.

I planned to meet a friend for lunch here. Arriving early, I stepped into the bathroom. When I emerged, I found a text on my phone from my friend confirming that we'd be meeting here. I looked up and saw him standing outside the restaurant, so I went to beckon him inside. The waiter saw this and was convinced, apparently, that I'd just come in to use the bathroom and leave...so started yelling at me to just get out. I tried to explain, but to no avail. He just became more insistent and more rude.

Needless to say, we chose to eat our lunch elsewhere...and I can't see coming back here to try again. There are too many options to put up with rude service.
author: Josh R.

description:
I came at 9:30, pulled the door to walk in... It was locked. One of the people behind the register looked at me through the glass, then said something to his peer who gave no indication of having seen me...and they carried on with their business. I knocked on the glass, no response. There was a couple eating inside. I checked the posted business hours... Close at 10pm. Checked Google maps, 10pm. Yelp 10pm. 

I'm sure they had a good reason for closing early, (Super bowl weekend), but they could've at least waved me on or come out to say they were closed rather than ignore me after making eye contact, as of I would simply disappear into thin air.

The previous times I was here the food was decent, if not a bit overpriced for the amount of meat. However after this, I won't be returning.
author: L E.

description: I went here because the sandwich place down the street didn't have a restroom to wash my kids hands. When we went in the restroom was for customers only so that is way I bought something. It was clean but small and good but pricey
author: Princess V.

description: I've been here a couple of times and the food is pretty good. 3.5 stars for this smallish casual Indian restaurant. My go tos are the: chicken tikka masala (curry chicken), this could use a little more sweetness. chicken boti (tandoori chicken chunks) could use a little more salt, but is otherwise quite nice and tender. mixed vegetables, good flavor. The regular naan and garlic basil naan is perfect, and just the right amount of fluffiness and not burnt like some other places. Their rice is nice and fluffy. Chai is free like most casual Indian joints and is good. All in all, I'll be back for more...
author: Ali F.

description:
Tasty naan, underwhelming rice, been coming here for ages, blah blah blah.

BUT OI - if you think I haven't noticed that you've decreased meat & paneer portions in curries to a laughable 2-3 quarter-sized pieces, you're wrong. I noticed. I'm watching you. You get one more chance, and then I'm out.
author: Nika M.

description:
Bad experience!
What is it with Indian restaurants forgetting to deliver the beverage???
So, besides that, the food was not good! i threw out half my food! what i did eat were the rice and naan. both main dishes - chicken vindaloo and chicken tandoori were just really bad!
the vindaloo was sour like if i was eating yogurt combined with vinegar! Not balanced!
The chicken leg tandoori was so awful i actually spit out the first bite. How bad of a cook to you need to be to mess up a grilled chicken leg?! It wasn't enough time in my mouth to actually know what's wrong with it. 
I am a chef, and maybe i have higher expectations but this was just pure bad food. my dish washer can cook better than that.
A waste of a good $25.
author: Eli E.

description:
Ok maybe hygiene is awful but it's the only Indian/Pakistani place open until 2 am. So Late night diners can't be choosers.
The place is in the part of the TL  neighborhood where, if late enough, you have to walk over drunk and crazy people. (Sorry, not PC.) but we were desperate for this cuisine.
So we were surprised by the ambience: cleaner appearing than Shalimar. Fresh paint, newer tables and chairs, spacious. And what's playing on the large screen TV? Not Bollywood. It was "Oklahoma" courtesy of PBS. 
We ordered the tikka masala with cheese and the fish masala, garlic basil naan, rice, mango lassi. Fish was prepared just right and cheese had nice texture. The Naan needed more garlic.
You have to set your own table and fetch your own water. Chai is complimentary.
Prices are very reasonable and they accept credit cards.
If you're looking for late night South Asian, try this place. You might get Sound of Music while enjoying masala.
author: Liana T.

description:
Two stars seems too low, but the food here was only OK -- I wouldn't recommend.

I ordered the chana masala (spicy), vegetable biryani (medium), samosa, and the garlic/basil naan. The masala was medium spicy at best, so if you eat here order a level spicier than you normally would. The chickpeas were also undercooked, and the sauce was bland. The dish lacked that slow-cooked depth of flavor that most people are looking for in good Indian food. The biryani was really heavy on carrots, which are not a personal favorite. Also very mild and pretty bland, I was not generally enthused about the quality of the dish. Of everything I tried, the samosa was the most balanced flavor and the best-cooked. The outside was golden and crisp, the inside was soft and well seasoned. The mint chutney that came with it was delicious, and oddly one of the spicier things on my plate. The naan here is also quite good, but I found it odd that for a takeout order they didn't even wrap it in foil - it's just dumped into a paper bag.
author: Kelly B.

description:
Best service I ever experienced at a non-fancy Indian restaurant.  Extremely courteous staff, eager to make sure every dish was to our liking.  The place itself is small but great for couples.

The garlic naan was so-so but appropriately priced, so no complaints here.  Besides, the primary reason why you'll want to come here is for the curry.  Beware, they don't compromise on the spice unless you explicitly ask for them to do so.  If you're anything like me, it might be a good idea to order a mango lassi or something with yogurt.  I got the lamb vindaloo and it was so delicious that I couldn't stop eating it, but I was already in tears by the third bite.  What can I say, the pain was worth it!

While I'm not sure I'd go out of my way (i.e., drive more than 30 minutes) to come here since SF is not utterly lacking in good Indian food, but it's a fantastic choice if you're nearby and/or want to order take-out.
author: Tiffany H.

description: We had some standards: chicken tikka masala, saag paneer, rice, and naan. All were exactly as you would expect:  tasty, nothing amazing, but nothing objectionable, either, exactly what you might want after a long work day. The naan tasted particularly fresh. The staff are friendly, the place was clean, and the prices are reasonable by SF standards. I will go back. If you're looking for a simple, tasty, comfortable meal, consider Tikka Masala.
author: Eric L.

description:
Seriously delicious food - FAST. The gentleman at the register gave me advice and recommendations and was so helpful. I'm now in a happy food coma thanks to this wonderful place!

I ordered the chicken tikka masala, onion naan and a side of rice. It took about 10 minutes if not even less, and I just had an incredibly fresh and delicious dinner.

I will definitely be back!!!
author: Lorri R.

description:
Stopped in here to introduce my brother to this delicious cuisine.  It did not disappoint!  We had lamb tikka masala, saag gosht, rice, and naan.  It was all scrumptious!  Now he's hooked.  The free chai wasn't the best I've ever had (thanks to a co-worker who brings it in from home), but it's FREE.  How cool is that?
The staff was super nice, and stopped by the table to check on us and chat.
This is a counter service place, and not fancy at all. Hopefully I'm never back at UCSF for broken family members again, but if I ever find myself in the area again, I'll be sure to stop in.
author: Daphne B.

description: We are boring and order the same thing a couple times a month: Chicken Tikka Masala, Aloo Gobi, Rice, and Garlic Basil Naan.  Everything else I've had has been really good here too, but the regulars are SOOOO good that I'm sad when I don't eat them.
author: Marci D.

description:
I came here with my girlfriend for dinner on a Friday evening with fairly high hopes, as the restaurant is in a good setting and has a cozy atmosphere inside. What is more is that it hasn't been shut down by the health inspector, which is pretty good for this area. Unfortunately the service and the food were disappointing.

The employees weren't actually rude or unpleasant, but they weren't exactly paying much attention. We both decided to order the restaurant's signature Tikka Masala. When it arrived it was lukewarm, and there were just five tiny pieces of chicken in each portion! The sauce was acceptable, but neither of us left there feeling satisfied. We were much more satisfied with the bag of kettle chips that we bought afterwards to fill our still empty stomachs.

Considering that I paid over $23 (with rice charged separately), I'd expect a lot more in terms of quality and quantity. I wouldn't come back.
author: James M.

description:
We have been going to this restaurant for many years, always great service, the tandoori chicken and nan bread are to die for.
Highly recommended .
author: Martin H.

description: Best Indian food by taste and price in the area and great service. The ambiance isn't  much but it's cozy on a cold SF night :)
author: Lindsay Y.

description:
My biggest annoyance is their hours. They need to open at 430 not 5. Why? Most people who they serve UCSF get off at 5. I can't tell you how many times I call at 5 and I get told 25 minutes for my food. That means I have to wait until 530 to get my food. 

If they opened at 430, took orders then SO much more business for them. 

The food is good, often you get decent amount of chicken, in a tikka masal for instance. SOme times you get 4 BIG pieces and I just break it up, other times its more even and more plentiful. The amount of meat you get varies. 

The Nan can be very hard at times. Often in the middle burnt and rock solid pieces are there. Inconsistant. 

Over all when you get a good soft nan, not over cooked rice and the right portion of chicken its all good and some one the best quality:cost ratio in the IS. 

But more than often you get 1 bad element to the dish and the hours starting at 5 for dinner is a mistake imo. They are open later than normal so that is a nice perk.
author: Benjamin W.

description:
My girlfriend and I come here a lot now...  It's a good deal and is pretty decent.

Reading some reviews made me realize that they don't really understand the place.  It is a order up at the front kind of joint but I think they should be a little more accomodating to people who think it is a normal restaurant.

Fish biryani is really tasty and a good deal.

Sometimes the food is better than others which either makes me want to give 3 or 4 stars but the staff has always been really nice to us so I just went with 4 because of that.

It is definitely not as bad as the other Indian spots in the area...  which can be a total nightmare.
author: William G.

description: The place and first doesn't lokk so good. But I was surprised how good is the food. I orderdeprwns with coconut sauce, and was delicious!
author: Flávia A.

description:
When they say spices in there dishes, man, is it spicy! But I loved it! The vegetarian dishes are fresh and cooked to perfection. The meat curries, from tandoori to saag, are well balanced with spices and vegetables and the naan bread is soft and fresh. I have been here a couple times with my friends and it never disappoints. The curry sauces are sooooo rich and delicious and the meat and vegetables are cooked with flavor!!! The place is pretty small, but that doesn't stop us from going inside and consuming all the food we order!!! 

I need to come back and try the lamb and goat dishes. It's a great place to take that special lady friend to try new food and have a great time with friends. Not a great place to take 20 people, but, you get my picture.

Overall: Food was delicious and fantastic, price was right, and service was great.
author: Nestor G.

description: I've been ordering delivery from this restaurant for more than 10 years! I live up the street, but tonight they refused to deliver to me and were very rude. They claimed they cannot park easily which is not true as we have parking under the building. I even told him and he refused. The last few times the owner was more abrasive than normal but this time he went over the line. You have great food but I'm shocked at your terrible customer service especially for a long time customer who refers people to you often. Not anymore.
author: Crystal H.

description:
I'm not what you would call a Pakistani nationalist. I'm not ignorant of my region's history and culture - I'm just not that crazy about it. 

However, I am, and have always been, a culinary jingoist. If you mess around with the food of my people I WILL END YOU. 

There are tons of Pakistani/Indian restaurants that are MEH. Truly, honestly enhhhh. There's probably a hundred between Berkeley and San Francisco alone. I feel nothing towards these places, and eating there is a function of staying alive rather than enjoying my meal. And that's totally fine. 

But Tikka Masala goes full retard in several ways that irritate me and shift it to being actively bad rather than neutrally nothing. 

1) The Food
The most obvious point I have to make is this: the food is BLERGH. It's not meh, it's not maybe ok, it's not misunderstood - it's mediocre. I ordered a naan, saag paneer, and  korma and I ended up being able to eat absolutely none of it. I have eaten at a lot of sub-par Desi restaurants, but Tikka Masala set an impressive new low. You know how delightfully racist TV shows and movies depict our food as gurgling, greasy, graying primordial ooze that will tear yo ass up? That's the shit right here. I understand that kids are starving in Africa so I try not to be an entitled prick who wastes food, but when I can't tell if the meat in my dish is lamb or reconstituted jelly meat substitute then i will toss that shit out, burn it with blue flame, and sprinkle holy water over the ashes as I sweep it into the toxic medical waste bin. 

2) Location, Location, LOCATION
Tikka Masala is located just a few minutes walk from the main campus and hospital of the University of California, San Francisco. If you know anything about medical schools/hospitals, ESPECIALLY in the Bay Area, you know that there are A LOT of hungry, hardworking Indian/Pakistani densely packed into that location. There was an opportunity here to do something great and they choked like the fat boy who would play far outfield in kickball and trip over his own feet trying to catch the ONE ball that would come his way (... some wounds never heal). 

3) Service
I'll be real and fair here, my anger at this place is weirdly intimate and personal. I think it all started with this point - I waited 40 minutes to pick up food that I was told would be ready in 10 minutes. I know that Pakistanis/Indians are all about that IST (Indian Standard Time) but that shit does not apply in the food service industry! 

But then again, maybe I shouldn't complain about that last point. Because every minute they made me wait was another minute I WASN'T eating their food. What a glorious 40 minutes that was....
author: Salman Q.

description:
(See pics)

Review #1023.

Sunny corner for a bright lunch. Fairly flavorful chicken and paneer dishes. Biryani was also quite good. and the naan was good. 

We saw quite a few Indians eat here so we believed it must be a popular authentic joint.
author: T L.

description: Ordered lamb biryani here. The chef needs to be fired, for sure he doesn't know how to cook a biryani. It had potatoes that were raw, excessive salt made the dish unbeatable. I threw it in the trash. Way Over priced. You can get better quality at naan curry for a better price
author: Kishor K.

description:
Food was pretty good. I had the lamb tikka masala and the meat was really tender. The sauce was a little bit spicy but not too much.The naans were not the best but they were decent.
The atmosphere was definitely not great, but it seemed clean and we wanted something simple so it was ok.
Prices were definitely cheap. Almost everything under $10!
Overall I think it's a good deal.
author: Virginie F.

description: This is a bread and butter Indian restaurant with great food at low prices. The menu is broad and the food is delightful. Not the prettiest place but it's definitely great for a quick lunch.
author: Sammy S.

description:
I use to love this place, however I've been extremely ill and to sick to walk the few blocks. I finally feel well enough to eat, I call for delivery at 9pm on a Thursday. 
  Guy on the other tells me my total is only $23.76 so I have to spend another $1.24 for them to walk 2-3 blocks. Yeah right with 3 Indian restaurants with a 3 block radius I'll pass.
 Times are hard but to nickel and dime your regular customers is disgusting.
author: Kelenia O.

description:
My friend and I went there for lunch this past Saturday. The reason we chose to go in there was because its door was wide open and we were lured by the wonderful smell of spice. We were seated in the back where there was no window to look out and a TV had Bollywood on nonstop. We ordered butter chicken and tandoori lamb. We were so hungry that we couldn't wait to have their wonderful smelling food!!  Well, unfortunately we were less than impressed. The lamb, instead of tender, was extremely dry and hard to chew. The presentation was pretty unappetizing also - several chunks of charred meat scattered on the plate...  The butter chicken was better but there was hardly any chicken in the sauce.  

There was a bug flying around and wouldn't leave us alone - guess it came in from the open entrance. Eventually it landed on the naan and we decided not to eat the naan. We left feeling very unsatisfied. We will not go back for sure.
author: Florrie M.

description:
Boyfriend and I went here tonight, got seated with no words from the host?, looked at the menu, figured out what we wanted and put the menus down. 15-20 minutes go by and no on checks up on us. We are hungry and want to order but despite our stares they never came by. In fact, I took notice that they didn't really check up on any of their tables.. all the tables had a pitcher of water and one person had to physically get up and ask the guy(s) behind the counter for a box and check. This same guy that gave the box my bf made eye contact with three times. You can read a lot on my bf's face and yet the only host/waiter is just chatting it up the whole time with another worker.

Yet never have I gone to a restaurant where they take your order and just... never get my order taken. This had to be a really bad omen of what was rest to come, their yelp page is outdated and everything has gone up in price about double. Realizing this place is two $ signs instead of one like the yelp page says it is we decide to just leave. Not over paying for bad service. 

When we left though the guy who my bf kept making eye contact with just waved. My man said "you should maybe take your customer's orders after you seat them at some point?" The guy just smirked and said ok. He really got heated at that and wanted to say more but I was already out the building. We never left a restaurant before, it was pretty bad, we almost thought it was because we were gay or something... such random rudeness we got there!

EDIT::
After reading other's reviews, especially the one by "Little Miss Picky" I am so glad we did the right thing and just left! I was getting the same problems so many other reviewers did, glad I didn't stay for the bad food and more bad service! Hahaha!
author: Tim V.

description:
So before I came to this restaurant I did not like Indian food AT ALL! I came here cause j went to lunch with some co workers and they said I just have to try this place and I'll love it. So fine I did. And it was absolutely AMAZING! I have come here about 4 times after and loved it every time. 
The Chicken Tikka Masala: super tender chicken, very flavorful but not overwhelming sauce that goes perfectly with rice or for dipping the naan into. 
Beef Kabob: perfectly cooked, super tender, and not dry at all. Also has lots of flavor and even goes well with dipping into the tikka masala sauce.
Garlic naan and regular naan: really good and not really dough. It's perfectly fluffy and goes well with all the sauces. 
I have also tried a few of the other dishes but don't remember their names. But they are all delicious!!! The dishes are kind of small so for 4 people lets say we order about 3 chicken tikka masala a, 1 rice  and 3 naans.
author: G O.

description:
Looks like we are not the only ones who found stuff in their food that does not belong there. I discovered a piece of metal in my channa-saag. When we reported it, the waiter casually shrugged his shoulders and said:
"Oh yes, this is a piece of the cleaning scrub we use to clean the utensils. It shouldn't be harmful. However I can give you another plate for you to feel safe" 
Ridiculous! Not one word of apology though!! Ofcors, I wouldn't ask for another plate of that same curry to 'feel safe'.  

The food was very average. Chicken Kadahi was nothing but plain Chicken curry. There are countless Indian restaurants in the city that has food that taste way better and in the same price range. Free tea isn't unique to this place either. Needless to say, we are never returning here.
author: Jayeeta K.

description: Got the paneer tikka masala, which is a serviceable tikka masala, if thin, and gently-spiced even for the species. Super nice guy running the place on a Saturday afternoon though, so points for service and atmosphere.
author: Chris D.

description: I have been coming here for a couple years now. I work at UCSF and usually  come here for lunch. The first time I came a couple years ago I was having difficulty deciding between paneer tikka masala and vegetable tikka masala. The person working the register said they can mix the vegetable and paneer into one dish. It was delicious, and that has been my go to order when I eat here. Today I decided to treat myself to some Indian food to go for dinner. When I called to order over the phone I explained I wanted the paneer tikka masala and vegetable tikka masala mixed into one portion. The person on the phone was having a difficult time understanding and said that is not a dish on the menu. I explained I had ordered it before, and he said okay he would make it that way since I have had it before. When I arrived to pick up my food there was a paneer tikka masala and mixed vegetable tikka masala with paneer. I explained I did not order the paneer tikka masala and the older man behind the register was very aggressive and rude saying I had ordered wrong over the phone, and next time to say mixed vegetable masala paneer. I understand mistakes can happen if the order is something not directly off the menu, but the way he spoke to me showed poor customer service. The other man working behind the counter perfectly understood what I wanted and quickly fixed it for me. The two star rating comes from the lack of customer service displayed by the older man working the register. If you have difficulty understanding orders over the phone, please let the man working behind the counter take the orders instead.
author: Aniek V.

description:
Oh what would I do if there were no tikka masala!!

the indian community at UC introduced me to tikka when i had just moved here from the old country.
for 1.5 years now, tikka has been my destination for Indian food in SF.

the food is good, free chai is great! the staff are friendly and the owner, Faisal, always has time to catch up and chat. if u r a regular, u r made to feel like a friend. 

Ive had them cater to parties at short notice, and they always come thru - with great food.

I always recommend tikka as the goto place for Indian cuisine in the inner sunset. try the paneer tikka masala,their signature dish with naan or rice. the daal-saag is amazing too, but you have to check for seasonal availability. 

p.s: this review is biased because tikka reminds me of home, but this place has great food and service none-the-less.
author: Prashant P.

description:
Visited Tikka Masala with friends on a Sunday evening.

Service: For a Small restaurant ; Service is like you would expect it - quick and attentive. I do have a gripe though; for a small restaurant ( 20 covers) you have to go to the cash register to place ur order. Considering that the staff was getting food to my table I don't quite understand why can't they take my order at the table too??? MYSTERY 

Food : Had 
- Chicken Boti : Dry & worst dish of the night
- Chicken Seekh Kabab : Best Dish of the night. Perfectly cooked and spiced.
- Lamb Chops : At 15$ for 3 Tiny no-meat and all Bone pieces .. it is a ripoff.. Whatever meat I got to taste  ( Party of 5 ) was good. You can skip this considering the price-point and the quantity on offer.
- Chicken Kadhai : Well made 
- Saag Paneer: Well made
- Naans : Aloo , Paneer, Onion, Keema , Basil-Garlic . Keema is the best 
- Chicken Biryani: A-OK  .. I have had better Pakistani Biryanis in-around SF. Had to ask for the Raita. I think this was a genuine oversight though
- Mango Lassi - Recommend you to skip this .. Have had better
- Chai :  Free - so go for it

All put together : For someone who used to live off on Naan-N-Curry food during my college days in SFo; Tikka Masala is no better if not different. Don't think I will come back as it does nothing different for me to stand out v/s Naan-N-Curry..
author: Abhishek R.

description:
A few days ago, I got out of work early, which is rare.  I was supposed to be working on something from home, but was craving Indian food, and as is my M.O., I figured it wouldn't hurt anyone to procrastinate a bit.  Yeah, that wasn't the smartest move.  But Tikka Masala was!

I was looking for something close to home, and checked out my fellow Yelper's reviews, which totally steered me right!  (Thanks, guys!)  This is why I was impressed...the menu is varied, prices are fair and reasonable, food is fresh, cooked to order, and comes out piping hot.  

Here's what was delish that we ordered:  Sag Paneer - FRESH spinach, wonderful level of spice, generous portions of paneer
Chicken Tikka Masala - not at all oily or greasy.  Basically, I wanted to lick the plate.
Raita - Balanced - nice cut up carrots and cucumbers.  Not too thick or gloppy - great consistency.
Tandoori Chicken - On the bone, but SO flavorful!  Was awesome to cut up and add to the tikka masala - made the sauce go even further.

Here's what was good, but not great:
Samosas - eh.  Kinda dry.  Just eh.
Naan - fine, but not super fluffy or flavorful.

The restaurant itself is no frills, but the servers are attentive and kind.  Free bottomless Chai is always a plus in my book!  Tikka Masala ...as Arnold says..."I'll be back!"
author: Brooke N.

description:
Wow. 

(1) The Lamb wraps. The muddafckin lamb wraps! Thumbs all the way up to the ceiling! So much flavor and it doesn't have that "musty" taste that is very common with lamb meat. I can tell that it is very well-marinated! The meat complements well with the fresh vegetables that comes with wrap. 

(2) FREE CHAI TEA. so delish. I had 4 cups. I couldn't get enough of it. If you like it sweetened, there is sugar on the side. I'm a sweet tooth so I dab that sugar to make everything nice :)

(3) GREAT SERVICE. I got mah agua after a split sec and the waiters are really kind.
author: Mark Y.

description: Went here randomly after an appt. It was pleasant inside lots of light and food was  great! The saag paneer was outstanding extremely fresh clearly fresh spinach had been used and the cheese is house made. The naan was interesting and delish kind of like wood fired thin crust pizza crust not super doughy. The tikka masala was totally good. And you can add that sauce for $1 to anything next time I will try w the okra. Everything was great! I will come here again even if I am not parked in front.
author: Precita M.

description:
Tikka masala and green peas tofu dish were enjoyable with rice.  It was a great mix of sweet with spicy, chicken and veggie.   Excellent, excellent service.

  I did not find anything in my food, but I'm not sure I would come back after reading the other reviews.  It'd be great if management would respond to the other complaints about finding extraneous items in the food.
author: Cherry F.

description: Their tikka masala is so good! Definitely beats Some of the places on Irving. It's not crowded either, but good and quick service. Free chai too!
author: Kevin X.

description:
My first experience with Tikka Masala was like, 'Meh, Naan N Curry does it way better.'

My 2nd experience with Tikka Masala (3 years later) was like, 'DANG Naan N Curry who?!'

Everything from their garlic and basil naan, eggplant curry (must try!), mini veggie samosas, and even their rice is amazing. Nice to know they are just down the street from UCSF so I can pop in for a quick lunch!
author: Liana L.

description: Tikka masala and garlic naan were good, but chicken korma was not as good. Rice is a bit dry but overall a decent place.
author: Geil M.

description:
We ordered chicken tikka masala, lamb tikka masala, rice, and naan for takeout.  I was surprised that my food was already packaged when I arrived less than 10 minutes after I called.  Cost was $26.  The chicken tikka masala was good.  The chicken appeared to have been roasted, but had been sitting in the sauce a bit longer than optimal.  The lamb had been in the sauce far too long and there was no charbroil or roasted flavor at all.  It was starting to fall apart like meat that had been boiled too long.  

The entrees were like something I might expect from fast food (like an indian version of panda express), but subpar for entrees that were supposed to be cooked to order.  The rice was ok, but a bit overcooked (like it had been left in a pot for a long time).  The naan was thick and very doughly.   It was not crisp at all as I would expect with fresh naan.    The portion sizes for the entrees were moderate while the portions for the naan and rice were generous.
author: Tennyson L.

description:
I have a love/hate relationships with Indian food. I do love the curry flavors, the strong flavoring of CUMin (yes, i went there), the CHAI, the nan, and the spiciness. BUT... what I don't enjoy is the possibillity of explosive diarrhea and a burning asshole. 

That being said, tikka masala has proved to give me all the things i love about indian food and leave the diarrhea to rest. (this can't be said for my experience at the nan n' curry down the street on irving. YIKES). 

I consistently order the chicken tikka masala and it is delicious. the sauce is creamy and i love sopping it up with their naan and the basmati rice. I am also a fan of the dal (lentils) and several of the lamb dishes. 

This is a nice spot of lunch (esp if you are at UC), service is fast and efficient, the chai and water are self serve. chai is a must!
author: Tim B.

description:
I was erroneously told this place was BYOB so I BY-ed my own B.  The staff graciously ignored my drinking my own beer while I ate (I didn't realized until after I left)  so kudos for an understanding wait staff

Warning: I am not picky when it comes to Indian food.  I can't tell the difference between good and mediocre.  That being said I'd call this place a REALLY good bargain.  Indian food gets expensive when you want to try a bunch of dishes but this place has prices that make it doable.  

Large chunks of chicken in the Tikka Masala.  Good garlic naan, not too spicy lamb lamb korma

Mostly the 4 stars represent the awesome what you get:what you pay for ratio  It's not that the food is so fantastic it's just a cheap way to get your Palak Paneer fix
author: Meg M.

description:
Had the Chicken Tikka Masala, Mixed Veg., naan, and rice.

Chicken Tikka Masala was good.  Usual Indian restaurant pricing.  Naan is non-traditional, still tasty but closer to a flat bread or thin crust pizza dough.
author: Gyasi K.

description:
I love this place!

Very close to where I studied. Love the food and the people.

Although everything is really good, chicken biryani and chicken korma are a must-try!

Food gets a little oily at times, hence the -1 star.

If not for this place, I would have died of hunger. Can't wait to go back to SF and eat here again!
author: Shreyas O.

description:
Okay, I hate that I have to write this review and give this place one star, but this is unacceptable.

This is the place we've been ordering from since Tasty Curry closed. It's probably the best-tasting Indian food in our area for the price, and out of the dozen or so times we've ordered from here, we've never had a problem... That is, until now.

I read one of the reviews for this place talking about finding shit in the food that didn't belong there; a used band-aid in the rice, a toenail in someone's curry, and I really didn't want to believe it... Now it seems I've experienced it.

What I found might not be as unusual or disgusting as the aforementioned things were, but as a vegan, I was pretty grossed out to find a piece of animal bone in my mouth after taking a bite of baigan bharta, which is a (supposedly) vegetarian curry consisting of eggplant.

I understand that mistakes happen, but with this place's track record, it almost seems like there's no regard for what gets scooped into the food here, and quite frankly that is disgusting.

I guess we won't be ordering from this place anymore. Sorry.
author: P A U L.

description:
The good:
Lamb Tikka Masala:  Not bad
Lamb/Beef Shish Kabob:  Good flavor

The bad:
Naan:  Too doughy.

The owner:  Nice but I do not appreciate him coming in to the restaurant while fighting a cold at the same time.
author: SF F.

description:
Being a Pakistani myself, I always say that no one on this planet can cook better than my mom until I met Tikka Masala. 

So whenever I'm in the city and missing my mom I always make a pit stop here. The owner has to be the sweetest let alone the cutest Pakistani/Indian man! 
The food here is delicious. From the lamb briyani to the fresh naans everything is yummy.

They have a variety of indian beers that puts me in such a great mood!
Oh, and don't forget to get a hot cup of COMPLIMENTARY chai! Delish!
author: Amara S.

description: I don't usually like writing negative reviews, but I feel like I need to warn others about this place. I saw the yelp reviews about people finding weird things in their food, but decided to give this place a chance anyway. BAD idea. My tikka masala was okay, nothing special. The to-go container was tiny though. It was barely enough for one meal but cost over $8. I didn't really mind though. The reason for the one star is the spoiled rice that they gave me. It had that smell that rice get after it's been left in the rice cooker for too long. I was hungry though and didn't want to go all the way back to complain.. so i ate it. My stomach was upset the whole night and I felt sick. I really wish I could like this place because it's at such a convenient location. Too bad.
author: Mc N.

description:
This place has some of the best Saag ever.  It's not that sloppy, smushy yuck that you usually get at any fast food Indian place.  No, this Saag has Character!  It is full and wholesome with actual leaves of spinach swirled together with a hodgepodge of delicious, aromatic spices.

I usually never order Saag but this place has changed my mind.  Actually.. all their food is rather good here, especially their delicious, fluffy naan.  (But to be honest, I've had better Tikka Masala!)
author: Kimiko Q.

description:
I love this place!! Five Stars!!

Food is great...service is great!!

This is my 2nd time trying Indian food & I love it. First time was at Naan & Curry. However Tikka Masala taste better & is cleaner.

Naan, Garlic & Basil Naan, Chicken Tikka Masala & Mango Chutney
http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/jli7cv-_5gljE7StZL65wA/l

Chicken Tandoori (Leg)
http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/xZ-EDRF_Nqu_ktF8H341aw/l

(Monday, January 19, 2009)
author: Kenny C.

description:
My friend recommended this place to me. She brought me there a couple of times and in the beginning since I am not really into Indian food, was a bit skeptical at first. As I came back to this place I really do enjoy it. 

Food and drinks

Naan - Fresh and Soft
Chicken Tikka Masala - Great when dipped with Naan
Tandoori Chicken (Drumstick) - Tender and delicious
Chai Tea - Free and tasty

Service
Order at register and they bring you the food.

Ambiance: 
Simple, they have tables and chairs.

Price:
It is pretty cheap for what you get.
author: Irene L.

description: Went here about 1 month ago to meet some people for dinner but I didn't get anything cause I already ate before hand and this dinner was late notice. Even though I already ate,  I got hungry again once they brought the food out. Definitely going back when I have an empty stomach!
author: Dang T.

description: Chicken Tikka Masala, Daal Muhkni, Paneer Pakora... yes please. Good place for delivery, they are quick and reliable.
author: Howie N.

description:
I don't know what all the haters are talking about. I ordered delivery from this place today and it was perfect. First they are quick with the delivery which is always nice. Most important, THE FOOD WAS DELICIOUS. Saag paneer with tons of decadent paneer; chicken tikka masala was great; naan was maybe not as soft as I'd hoped but I was happy with it; and the samosas were tasty. The only dish I didn't like was the tandoori chicken, just wasn't feeling it so much. 

Portions were pretty big; the food is going to last me for like 3 meals. And definitely not too expensive.
author: Latte Queen W.

description: Very good food. We ordered some authentic dishes and they didn't disappoint. The service was great until the end when they made us box up our own leftovers. We thought that was a bit tacky. Overall- if craving some Indian- great place !
author: Caitlin S.

description: Meh meh meh meh. Sure it was cheap, but I really only found one plate worth eating at the lunch buffet. The chai tea was horrible and the pans for the buffet were not even warm. I was confused, I guess, because I assumed there would be more vegan options.
author: Shanna D.

description: Pathetic chicken biryani. No spices, poor quality rice and bland chicken. Not at all worth $10.90
author: Deepak C.

description:
WARNING: Matt is exceptionally inebriated when typing this review.

After having one too many "Sex on the Beach", Matt decided to eat here to absorb the alcohol in his system.

Somehow, someway, and being a little under the influence of one too many drinks, Matt drove to this Indian restaurant and somehow and miraculously ate here.

He had a Tandoori Chicken Breast with side of Jasmine Rice and a side of Garlic Naan. The $3.00 spicy Indian-spiced chicken-breast was very spicy and was the perfect cure to absorb the alcohol from Matt's system. After the tasty spicy Indian cuisine meal, Matt slowly regained his severity and once again able to be clear-headed once again

Matt don't do get smashed often, but eating just about anything including a spicy Indian cuisine is the perfect cure.
author: Matt G.

description: Food is yummy and comes out fairly quickly.   Chicken tikka masala is delicious and chicken biryani has a generous portion. Free chai is a definite plus and one of the things that keeps me coming back. Recommend giving them a try!
author: M B.

description: This is a simple, fresh Indian cafe.  Nothing fancy, but not greasy and very cheap.
author: Christine R.

description: i went to this place with my friends reading the good reviews. first of all the place is too congested. we had chicken biryani, chicken tikka masala and tandoori chicken. liked their chicken tikka masala but chicken biryani was really bad! i prefer to pay little more if necessary than paying average and getting too low in the plate. not happy! i dont think i would go back there ever!
author: Natalie N.

description:
Just before our wonderful date at the A.C.T. watching A Christmas Carol, we came here because 1 - it's up the street, 2 - I wanted to compare it to my favorite Indian restaurants in Berkeley. 

Food:
Chicken Tikka Masala - It had nice flavor and nice color to it. It was definitely a good sized portion and I was full off of the whole thing, but that's because I didn't have lunch on that day. I often forget to eat if I'm busy with other things aka studying. 

Service: Everything here is self-serviced for those who didn't realize. The water you must get yourself. The cups are by the tea, and the water in the fridge area. The tea is also self serviced, and it is definitely not as good as the chai tea that I'm used to. Just go up to the front and order. The food comes within 10 minutes which isn't bad, but it was just weird to be the ONLY people sitting in the restaurant. 

Overall, it wasn't a horrible experience, but it was just weird. To most of the Indian restaurants I go to, I'm not the only couple sitting there eating. The tikka masala wasn't bad, but it's just not as good as my comfort food in Berkeley.
author: Nina Y.

description:
Food here is good (way better than some of the ones in the same area), but not great. Maybe it is just my preference, but the tikka masala was too watered down for me. It wasn't the creamy consistency that I like and the flavors were not all there. The chicken vindaloo was better than other places that I have tried. 
I like the free chai tea and the naan was pretty good. 
Really small place with tiny tables for two that barely fit the 4 dishes we ordered. 
And there service...barely there, dropped of food and that was it. No smiles, no asking how was the food. Not the welcoming attitude that I was used to at Tasty Curry. I was a dedicated "Tasty Curry" fan, but since that place closed down I am looking for a replacement. Still searching.....=(
author: Jenn T.

description:
Wha?

I think Tikka Masala deserves at least 1/2 star rating higher than Naan-N-Curry if not for the price alone. $4-6 a dish is fine by me. When the price starts creeping up to $8 like at Naan-N-Curry, I have to say, "Na ah."

I've always gotten take-out at Tikka Masala since I live nearby, but I would like to eat in sometime since patrons get free tea. Dishes are simple and have never disappointed, serving sizes are fairly generous, and the workers seem to be in a much better mood than the workers at Naan-N-Curry.

(NOTE: Sorry for all the Naan-N-Curry complaints...Probably just should have written a review for them, but I'd rather praise the better restaurant.)
author: Kym M.

description:
Pretty low on ambience BUT priced so you can enjoy Indian food the way you should. Too many places charge entree prices for Sag Aloo, Bombay Aloo or all those other tasty veggie side dishes that go great with curry. Tikka Masala allows you to order lots of side dishes because theirs cheap and a few curries. The Naan are good but no Keema Naan unfortunately was not on the list. The chicken Korma was bereft of coconut milk but still tasty. The Vindaloo was calmed down for our appetite which was nice.
Free chai tea when you dine in which was a nice touch. We were there for lunch and it was not busy but definitely inexpensive.
I would go again for sure
author: Adam O.

description:
Wow this food is good.  Get off your high horse and serve yourself your Free chai and water cause not everything in every restaurant is the same.  The food is as good as its going to get.  Parking is alright, but then again where is it great in SF?

Plain Naan- good to soak up the curries.  Good naan
Chicken Kofta - I recommend, its savory with 3 meatballs of tasty goodness and the sauce is just wow.  Time to spoon some over rice.
Chicken Vindaloo- Spicy sauce and the chicken was juicy and tender, but you might want to eat this toward the end as it kinda blasts your taste buds.
Lamb Biriyani - So yeah I like lamb and this won't hurt your feelings or anything if you eat it.  Its just throat swallowing good.

It's a little confusing when you enter but go to the counter when you enter to order your food.  Get your water or free chai; have some stimulating conversation while waiting for your food to arrive.

Decor: 4
Food:4
Service: 3 (Not full service mostly for your expectations, but the hostess is nice and friendly)

Would I go back? You bet your pastrami I would!
author: Kelson H.

description:
So, I finally got takeout here recently a couple of times, and I was pleasantly surprised.  

First, the baigan bharta was delicious--it was creamy and flavorful and really tasty--one of the best I've ever had (I'm  from being an expert in Indian food).

Second, the chicken tikka masala was tasty also.  While others say that there's not much chicken (this is true), the flavor of the chicken and sauce are both good--the chicken has a nice smoked flavor and the sauce itself has a nice, subtle heat to it.  

Third, the guy who does takeout during the day is incredibly pleasant and nice.   

Anyway, I actually think the baigan bharta and chicken tikka masala are better than those of masala restaurant on 9th.  

anyway, i have no idea if I've ordred wrong in the past or whether there has been a major change, but let's just say that I'm glad that the food has been solid in my recent experience.
author: Howard T.

description: Pretty solid food. Tikka Masala is one of my usual go-to spots in the Inner Sunset if I'm in the mood for some saag paneer or tikka masala. The food isn't mind-blowingly good, but it does the trick!
author: Abby C.

description: Delicious food, great service, good prices. I love indian food and have been to a fair amount of indian food places in sf. This is one of the best. Their vegetable tikka masala is one of the best dishes I have tasted. This place is a MUST TRY!
author: David W.

description: I'm embarrassed to admit I ate here. It was open, they deliver, it's Indian food - how bad could it be? It could be bad. Make that: BAD.  And, to risk sounding like a Woody Allen joke--and the portions are SO small.  My friend and I ordered Saag Paneer, Chicken Korma and Lamb Korma. I had the Chicken Korma and some Saag Paneer. The Saag Paneer was ok, but there was almost no cheese in it. The Chicken Korma was 2---two---pieces of chicken, and I have no idea where they even got chicken like this---it was ALL bone and gristle. I'm serious: bone and gristle. AND it wasn't even Chicken Korma! I have had Chicken Korma for 20 years. This was red watery greasy sauce on some bony blobs of chicken. My friend's Lamb Korma also was red watery greasy sauce---not Lamb Korma. More like LAME Korma. There were exactly 3 pieces of meat in his dinner. Most disappointing Indian food I've ever had.
author: Swiss C.

description:
My wife and I attempted to hit Pomelo on a Saturday for lunch.  Clearly we should have checked the hours first.

The olfactory senses pointed us to this place, and we were not disappointed at all!  We recommend this place:
+ GREAT naan!  Eat it while it's hot - the garlic and basil one is especially good.
+ Curries and vegetarian dishes are really good.  (Sadly, I don't remember the name, but we had one with chickpeas that was particularly good.)
+ Really good prices
author: Andrew M.

description:
I used to live just up the street from Tikka Masala.  It became my second dining room - either I would saunter down on a Saturday morning, or stop by on my way home from a long bike commute from work.

Now I live farther out in the avenues, and they deliver dinner - nothing like the arrival of warm naan and the aromas of saag, chicken tikka masala, keema aloo, and samosas to make my evening.

I highly recommend the above items, as well as the aloo naan.  The free chai is also nice if you are dining in.  I would like a little more tangyness in the mango lassis, but on the balance this is easily one of my all-time favorite Indian/Pakastani places.
author: Kevin B.

description: Their Chicken Tikka has amazing flavor! I dip my naan into it! Num!! Our Indian friend said the naan is thicker than he is used to, but we still liked it a lot! Great prices too!
author: Kari E.

description: I like this place. The owner is really nice and I believe its a family business. I have a soft spot for family businesses because my parents used to run one. Their food is good - if you know what to order - and I haven't seen any nasty things in my food as others have claimed here, but their hours are a little strange. They open morning, close mid-day for a while, then re-open until ten. Try not to come during closed periods. I don't know their names here but the man (and his wife?) are extremely friendly, out-going, and patient with the customers. ENJOY!
author: Apple F.

description:
Now that I'm not in Berkeley anymore, I get crazy cravings for Middle Eastern food.  When I was in SF this weekend and we couldn't decide where to eat, I immediately suggested Indian food and I'm soo glad I did.

We walk in and the place looks tiny and a bit shabby.  I ordered the chicken tikka masala (it is the name of the restaurant, after all), but I also try my friends' baigan bharta (roasted mashed eggplant with onions.....so flavorful ) and chicken korma.  Everything was delicioussssss, it definitely reminded me of homemade Indian food. It wasn't swimming in oil like the food at most places, and it was pretty cheap (naan and entree came to about $8 before tip).  There is also free chai tea!  The naan is cut into pieces for you (like how they cut up pita for you at a Mediterranean place) which was good because we had 5 people sitting at a table for 4...no room for huge pieces of naan.  It was coooked perfectly for the most part, but there was some burnt parts that were hard to chew.  

The service isn't great, but it isn't terrible.  The workers weren't very friendly but they got us our food in a prompt manner and didn't kick us out when we overstayed our visit.
author: Jenny W.

description: Best indian food in the city. great prices, friendly owners. Go on Monday, which is when they have their spice delivery and the food is extra delicious. Although it's great any day of the week. When I lived in the inner sunset I was here 1-3 times a week.
author: Melissa A.

description:
Their food is ok, but the service is bad.  Their website is also sloppy.  It's hard to find critical information such as their phone number. Also, their website doesn't state anything about a minimum amount for delivery.  I understand places requiring a minimum amount for delivery, but $25 is too much and it limits your customer base.   

I called to place an order for myself tonight, expecting to have it delivered.  When all was done, the bill would have been $23 before tax. The guy on the phone said it must be a minimum of $25 for delivery.  Stupid is all I have to say! I'm three to four blocks away, and they can't deliver because the bill before tax is $23. Oh yeah, the dude told me I could come in and get the food....defeats the whole purpose of delivery.  

This restaurant is just another typical San Francisco inconvenience.  As I told the guy on the phone, it's his loss, not mine.  I will order else where and won't be returning.  It's not worth it.
author: Ryan M.

description:
Self-service. Meaning, get your own menu, order at the counter, grab your drink in the fridge behind you and choose a seat. 

The pros: the food was delicious! We ordered the garlic & basil naan (served in 4 pieces)--$1.99, Chicken Vindaloo--$6.99 and Aloo Gobi--$5.99. The portions were a little small in my opinion, but it was super tasty, I wasn't that hungry so I ended up leaving full.
author: Caryl C.

description: Solid Indian restaurant.  Generous portions of naan and free chai tea plus the usual dishes.  Helpful servers as well.
author: Kim K.

description: Good food, great service, hospitable staff, chai always available, creamy sauce, delicious meat, specials worth trying, etc, and so on. What's not to like?
author: Matt B.

description:
This is my new go-to Indian delivery place.  I have ordered a couple times now.  The food is reasonably priced and tastes really fresh.  The saag actually tasted like fresh spinach and was some of the best I have ever had anywhere.  They deliver in a very timely manner and everything is piping hot upon arrival, packaged very well and delicious!!!

It doesn't hurt that the delivery guy is adorable and as friendly as you can get!  For Indian delivery in the sunset this place ROCKS!
author: Robert P.

description: I think I ordered the two best dishes here: CTM (namesake) and chana masala. Along with the free chai (which was much improved from 2006), everything was flavorful, affordable, served fast, and good. Impressed.
author: Andrew K.

description:
I think this place is great. Whether take out or eating in the restaurant, the food is great. The people who work there are incredibly friendly and very helpful. 

Once we actually went there just to pick up rice and naan as someone at home was cooking. Out of curiosity, we asked the guy there (maybe the owner?) about some obscure spice that we didn't get because it was SUPER expensive at Safeway. He told us that they bought it in bulk and it was way cheaper that way, so he just gave us a bunch of it. (I can't remember for the life of me what the spice was). We offered to pay for it, but he refused. 

The food is always good and I've never had a complaint about any of the variety of dishes I've tried.

For friendly service and good food, Tikka Masala is great place to go.
author: Amy A.

description:
No matter how many places we go, how much money we spend, what new things we try - no Indian restaurant in the Bay Area has unseated Tikka Masala's chicken tikka masala and naan as the best cheap meal in our book. Not one.

It's not flashy, it's not sexy, it's not trendy. It's just good. And it's cheap, to boot.
author: Rick S.

description:
I have eaten here before, just had another run at Tikka Masala with take out instead of eat in.  The food was excellent and the quality of the meal was preserved even with the transport time home.

The naan, an integral part of any meal, was well grilled.  The dough was even without undercooked or burnt areas.  It was durable for picking up pieces of succulent meats and dipping in savory sauces.

The chicken tikka masala was tender and flavorful in a savory sauce.   This was one of my favorite dishes from Tikka Masala.  I figured the name of the restaurant implied that this was likely a signature dish for them and it was well worth it.  The sauce is rich and multi-dimensional.

The lamb korma was also excellent.  The lamb was kept moist and tender with no "gamey" taste.  The sauce was thick and succulent and paired nicely with the naan and lamb.

Other dishes we got were the chicken tikka, daal, saag aloo, and saag paneer.  I enjoyed the creamy spinach in the saag dishes but found I preferred the saag aloo (potato) to the saag paneer (cheese) as the potato spinach dish had a cleaner more vibrant taste to the spinach and helped to cut through the other dishes.  While the paneer was a bit too creamy and rich for my taste (still good though).

The daal lentils were also very well done as well as the chicken tikka, but the star was the lamb korma and the chicken tikka masala.  Great restaurant and a keeper on the short list of places to go for dinner.
author: Jason N.

description: not fancy but very honest indian food. I have tried a few Indian places in SF and so far, this is the only place that comes close to my Indian food experience from London. Well done!
author: Joe G.

description:
I came here and didn't have any problems.

I ordered a mango lassi, chicken tikka masala, basmati rice, aloo naan, and  vegetables samosas. The chicken tikka masala was nice and creamy, the naan was soft and flavorful, and the samosas has just the right amount spices. 

My food tasted great, the server checked up on us,  prices were fairly reasonable!
author: rue s.

description:
I come here fo the food. The have some of the best Indian. Everything I tried here I liked so far. I love their chicken tikka masala- my favorite dish here. Also their samosas are good.

Some of the things I don't like are that the drinks are self serve, and the service in general. It's just not very friendly or welcoming, it seems like Management couldn't care any less. Only reason I come here is because of the food. This is one of those hole in the wall type of places. The prices are also really good. I would suggest getting takeout.
author: Emily G.

description:
This is my favorite Indian food in the city! 

The Naan is always cooked perfectly and every dish I've ever ordered here was great! 

It isn't the place for table service but you order and sit down and they bring you delicious plates of food! Great date place and in one of my favorite neighborhoods! Plus, you can get a great dinner for $11 (including tax and tip).

Order the Chicken Tikka Masala, because it is always so delicious, and then branch out and try something new!

Also, the staff is super nice and very helpful.

Unlimited Chai...can't go wrong, really.
author: Chelsea H.

description: I live in the neighborhood and eat here more than anywhere else. A humble environment with delicious food. Go here for good Indian with out the fluff!
author: Basil C.

description: So delicious! Love the chicken tikka masala and garlic naan. Definately recommend.
author: Cat H.

description:
Nobody puts curry in a corner.

What I mean is, this light-n-airy cafe-esque corner location just doesn't work for Indian food.  Indian food should be served in a dark, claustrophobic den suffocating under the smoke and heat of a roaring Tandoori furnace.

Food-wise, I've sampled enough of TM's dishes to say that it's perfectly ordinary Indian food, which in these parts puts it solidly behind New Ganges, N&C, and Tasty Curry.  Nothing has stood out and the sauces don't seem to vary much across dishes.  The one unique item is the quail masala, and while the meat flavor works well for curry, the extreme boniness makes it hard to shovel into your mouth at a satisfactory rate.
author: Wes M.

description: My parents came here for lunch one day during their visit to SF. I think the food was fine, and it all tasted pretty good. However, my mom found a hair under her pile of food, and politely brought it up to the waiter. Although he tried to remedy the situation, he kept saying things like "No one in here has hair that long." ... as if he was blaming my mom (who has short hair). Furthermore, the hair was found UNDER her food, instead of on top, which means it was probably on the bottom of the plate to begin with. If there's hair in your food, then whatever. It's probably not going to kill you, but it's just bad practice. But the right thing to do is to take responsibility for it and not blame your customers for your careless service or anything else that goes wrong in your business.
author: Rhea K.

description:
Service- Good

Food - Great (Chicken Tikka Masala, Garlic Naan, Seekh Kabob and Saag Paneer all reminded me of home cooking)


Happiness with everything (including the $ spent)- Couldn't be better. 

Trust me, Tikka Masala serves Pakistani/Indian food and I am 3/4 Pakistani.
author: Ayub M.

description:
This is actually one of my favorite Indian restaurants. Although the portions are smaller than Naan 'n Curry, I think the food is less fattening and more fresh. 

Also, service is great. The main cashier guy is very genuine and patient. No complaints there.

The only reason why I knock off one star is because I think the portions can be a little larger. Other than that, I love this place!
author: Marvin R.

description:
Last night a friend and I made some Indian food. This was the first time either of us had EVER tried cooking Indian food.

Guess what?

It was drastically better than Tikka Masala.

IF you gave this place more than two stars, you are a fool.
author: Paul M.
