description: Great selection of food, delicious. Surprised it wasn't busy! Friendly staff, clean restroom.
author: John W.

description:
Class ends around 9:30pm at the UCSF Campus.. As I walk out with my friend in the foggy atmosphere, all i can think of is how my stomach is growling like no other and insanely cold SF can be compared to San Jose.. cafeteria food is closed across the street and we are all the way up on a hill.. As we drove down Judah street, my friend looked closely with his hawked eyes for a bright OPEN sign on the door of the restaurant...and IT WAS! we looked at each other and i turned abrupty to find parking right on the street.. That was how hungry we were.. but at the same time, we talked about our indian food craving throughout lecture... talk about focusing in class?

We walked right in with 10 minutes to spare.  I felt bad because that meant they had to stay longer but the workers didn't mind since they apparently ate their late night dinner also.  The guy told us "You have one hour!" when our food was served.. but hey! we wanted to head back home also so we finished in like 20 mins ha! Quick and friendly service.. music provided in the background. Chai tea free also!

This is a small fast food joint for a campus restaurant.  Convenient and fast. Plenty of chairs and tables.  Nothing too fancy but who needs fancy on campus?  Very cheap prices from $5 to $10 a plate.  I was very surprised!  Affordable for students.  I give them 3 stars according to the quality of the food compared to other Indian restaurants.  We ordered the Chicken Tikka Marsala and Chicken Aag. I preferred the Tikka Marsala since i love saucey curry. Perfect for dipping with our Garlic Naan.  They used chicken breast for the meat which was healthy!  The other dish was made with spinach.  There was no sauce to it since it was just covered in spinach.  There wasn't much chicken pieces in there though. I was fooled! I thought they were just buried in the massive green mush my friend chose to order!  The naan was alright.. a bit too crispy at some pieces.. I felt like i was just eating crunch pieces and no bread.. I didn't really taste the garlic itself so that was a bit of a downer.. Overall, it did satisfy my quick indian craving for the night though!

Total: $17 for the night  Cheap or what?
author: Kathy D.

description:
Wow, I can't believe some people are tearing this place up so badly in their reviews. I think this food is great. I have never eaten there, just ordered for pick up and had it delivered. I can see that sitting at the restaurant could be a rather different , maybe even somewhat uncomfortable experience but I can't say that this place has done me wrong ever. It is very well priced considering the amount of food you get per entree. The chicken tikka masala is very tasty as is the lamb tikka. It all tastes delicious to me.
As far as the people that say they had bland food, they must be life long smokers or something  because this restaurant does not have bland food. Everything I have tasted was flavorful and yummy. HOpefully they don't raise their prices because then it won't be a five star place, but just four stars. 

Try it someday, it is good food.

-----------------------------
They raised their prices and have a minimum $25 order for free delivery. I have to downgrade to four stars now- sorry Tikka Masala, you did it to yourself.
author: Tony M.

description:
Only been here once. I enjoyed it. my dining partner didn't.

Ambiance: Cute hole in the wall. We're still not sure if you're supposed to order at the table or walk up to the host stand. Clean and comfy.

Chai: Delish! The perfect flavor, unlike the chalky stuff over at Curry Village. Oh, and it's unlimited and free! I managed to empty the supply, and was sad. In no time they prepared a fresh batch that was ready before my cup was empty :)

Naan: The onion and garlic naan was amazing. Right textures and flavors. The Aloo naan is not very good here - save that one for Naan N Curry.

Meals: No buffet here. Hubby got the Chicken Biryani. He said although it was spicy, it was completely flavorless. I got the Vegetarian version of Tikka Masala. It was good, although confusing. I kept wondering if the curry was cream based. I do think if I had ordered a lest Westernized dish I would have enjoyed the meal even more. They didn't have my favorite desert - Kheer/ Indian rice pudding.

Price: $25 for two! I thought it was worth it.

Ok, so, I eat Indian food all the time. This is one of the first times the food gave me an upset stomach :(
author: Zee S.

description: Delicious and consistent across the board. I have tried a lot of Indian restaurants in the bay area and this is definitely a top contender. Chicken tikka and goat karahi was full of flavor. Keep up the good work.
author: D M.

description:
Not impressed. One star for it being close to school and one star for having homemade, tender paneer but that's as far as I can go. 

The dishes were okay. Nothing to write home about and in keeping with the two-star rating on Yelp, I've definitely had better. The lamb korma was greasy and it separated in the dish. The spinach and paneer was the better of the two dishes we ate but it was only redeemed by their good cheese. 

I was excited to sample their free chai but was sadly disappointed. It tasted like scalded milk and lacked the spicy chai taste that I love. Gross.

I live around the corner from Indian Oven and have been spoiled. If you gave this place 5-stars, you need to check out a real, tasty Indian dinner that will blow your mind. Hustle down to Lower Haight and have some good Indian food that's not going to break the bank.

My friend bought dinner and I'm grateful for the meal but I don't think I'll return.
author: Corey F.

description:
I tried the chicken vindaloo with paneer naan the other day, and it was so, so, so delicious! The meat was moist and the spices were perfect. Just the right amount of heat.

I've yet to be disappointed with Tikka. Keep up the good work, boys!
author: Chelsea H.

description:
Meh.

On one hand:
- It's cheap for Indian
- There aren't too many other Indian places in the Inner Sunset, let alone good ones (I'm sorry, but I've never understood the appeal of Naan N Curry other than it's a good late-night place to go after you've had a couple, and Tasty Curry is anything but)
- It's clean and bright with decent amount of seating

On the other hand:
- The food is just at mediocre.  As other reviewers have said the oil has separated in most of the dishes by the time you get them.  I *know* Indian food uses a lot of oil, but this is the first time I've actually had to see all of it.  Although it's handy for portion control--I ate way less than I usually do.
- The main guy handling the front of house was a little pushy and we had to tell him twice that we weren't ready to order yet.  There was no one else in there, so it wasn't like we were holding them up.
- I had to go up and ask for the bill.  Maybe he was trying to make up for jumping the gun at the beginning?

I'd go again if I was dying for Indian food and not able/willing to wait for delivery from some place else, but it's nothing special.
author: Jen D.

description: I love the Palak Paneer with extra Paneer, and everything is pretty tasty here.  Verrrry good for the price.
author: M P.

description: It is a pretty typical indian food restaurant that I can't really complain about other than the price. It is a little pricier than some other Indian restaurants I have been to.  The chicken tikka masala was nice and sweet with a little kick to it with the spices and the naan was soft and fresh.  The chicken was not as soft and tender as I would have liked.  Overall, it is a decent place to go to and the service is friendly and fast.
author: Lawrence E.

description:
The Paneer Tikka Masala had a decently creamy orange-red sauce, with a good cheese to sauce ratio.

But my dining companion complained that his chicken tikka was much too dry. (At least there was lots of it).
author: angela n.

description:
I like this place, its a little laid back curry spot, not pricey but good!

i usually get their spinach curry with cheeze, chicken tikka masala, chicken biryani, garlic and aloo naan. 

Its awesome on the nights when you are tired and not wanting to cook but want something different. You go in, order your food at the register, sit down and drink some free chai which is pretty good as well, and wait for your food. Good spot.
author: chihiro i.

description:
When I was eating here, I couldn't stop missing Chicken Makhani from Punjabi Tandoori in San Diego. Maybe if I never had good Indian food I would've thought this place was okay. The lamb was dry and salty. Other things were so-so. I couldn't remember what else we ordered because my mind was preoccupied with thoughts of Chicken Makhani from Punjabi. 

Free chai though, and it was decent.
author: Xiaoyin W.

description:
i better write this review while i still smell like lunch before i stoop into a fat induced coma...

took my staff here lunch and got the chicken tikka masala, lamb boti, veggie biryani, channa masala, aloo naan, garlic naan, and mango lassi.  man i sound like a fatty.  anyway, the food was...meh.  everything was very watered down tasting and i guess maybe it was?  the sauces, even the mint and tamarind chutneys were not viscous at all.  the mango lassi tasted and looked watered down.  (sad face)

the dude who worked there was nice, but unless i'm dying for indian food and this place was the only one opened, i'm pretty sure i won't be back.

btw, came out to about 50 bucks.  i love paying for meh food.
author: Sally T.

description: I usually get cravings to eat Indian cuisine maybe twice a year but now that we've tried Tikka Masala, we're going to be eating it a lot more!  We had it delivered per the timeframe that was mentioned when we ordered and the gal that dropped it off was super friendly and polite! Thank you for the wonderful service! We had the Aloo gobi, Chicken saag, Lamb Biryani, Nan and white rice - all delicious.  The flavors of the dishes retained the integrity of the produce used yet was intensely 'Indian', everything was very fresh and just delicious.
author: Charlotte C.

description:
Blech.  First off, when we went here, they had newspaper all over the floor to mop up some sort of flood that was almost coating the entire floor.  So, there were chunks of sopping newspaper under the tables, and under our feet.
The food lacked flavor and there was some sort of unidentified object in my boyfriend's curry.  He was convinced it was a cockroach at first and, although he was wrong, we both lost our appetites, as it definitely looked like it a bug initially.  My curry was watery and we never got our naan order.  They also seemed irritated to be asked for water, which bugs the hell out of me.  
Skip this place, you'd be better off just walking down to the 9th and Irving area for more options.
author: Jessica L.

description:
They got the job done..I walked in, wanted some daal to go, told the guy so and he made it happen for 5 bucks. 

No complaints, but nothing special either.
author: Jason R.

description:
I think this is the best Indian food in the Inner Sunset (a neighborhood know for great sushi - not good Indian food).  Tasty Curry certainly isn't bad either, but Tikka Masala just nudges it out.  

The food is slightly above average, the restaurant is clean (a problem for several of the other Indian restuarants in the neighborhood), and the staff is very friendly (a serious problem at the Naan-n-Curry in the Inner Sunset).  I was tempted to give them an extra star because of the autographed photo of the actor who played the Skipper on Gilligan's Island - but I restrained myself.
author: Matthew H.

description: Better than some in the sunset but still not good.  Indian food can be better than this people.
author: Zack S.

description:
This food was VERY GOOD, and to all you haters out there i went with a woman who was BORN AND RAISED IN INDIA AND COOKS AMAZING INDIAN FOOD HERSELF!!!
 
We ordered so much food that I honestly don't even remember everything we ordered besides the chicken tikka masala (yum!)  and the naan. The naan stands out mostly because we ordered the garlic naan, but I think they may have given us plain by accident (this is the only reason I don't give it fve stars). The service was extremely friendly, I think it helps that the woman I went with knows the owner personaly and he served us, and fast. We also got this mango yogurt drink which I would highly recommend, it was tasty and it was cool because they gave it to you in a to-go style cup so if you didn't finish you could take it with you. 

Another good thing was the free chai tea. This was authentic chai tea which was awesome after years of drinking "westernized" chai. The difference in taste is huge but the tea was still very good. I plan to return soon!
author: Stephanie S.

description: This is terrible restaurant.  Service is terrible.  Not offered a glass and ice for soda, only the can.  No water provided.  You have to get up and get your own water.  Portions are small, but so are the prices; however, you only get four pieces of meat per order so I don't think it a value.   The chicken tikka masala and lamb vindaloo were ok.  One order of rice is only good for one person and the waitress never came back until she delivered the check and then asked if we wanted more rice.  Lots of men sitting around but only the woman waitress was working.  Never asked if we needed water or additional soda.  People came in for take out and then more to dine in.  The waitress was busy with take out orders so the diners i had to get up and order their food from her at the cash registers, all while the men sat around doing nothing.  Bottom line: the place is a dump and should close.  Don't waste your time or money.
author: Michael C.

description:
Utensils are clean!!!!  The chicken tikka masala is very good... spicier than NnC.  I LOVE the Chana Masala here (chickpeas).  Their palaak paneer is wonderful!  Get the mango chutney to balance the spicy flavors of the other dishes.  They opened a 2nd location in the Haight.  The prices are more reasonable too!  

(did I mention they have clean utensils/plates/glasses?)
author: Grace M.

description: OK.  I have called here twice for delivery only to be told, "we aren't doing delivery tonight."  It is Friday night at 6:30.  Seriously.  I mean the first time I thought maybe they had a situation, but the 2nd time.  Terrible.  She even asked for my address anyway...what is the purpose of asking my address I asked to which she replied, "oh no it is not close enough."  Were they going to have someone run over?  I am confused.  Anyhow, one star for the we can't deliver speech...just get rid of delivery.
author: Bonnie Marie J.

description: So soo soooo good. Incredibly hard to put down, and I couldn't help but to keep grubbing! I am a new lover to Indian food, and I would highly recommend this spot. Great flavor, and a good amount of food for under $25. I'd say we were more than pleased, and I believe that I will be seeing them again very soon. The only thing I would suggest to NOT order..the pickles. Way too salty for my taste, but who knows, to each their own." Enjoy SF, Tikka Masala has my vote!
author: Kelly Z.

description:
The food is still edible, it's just not good. What happened? I used to like this place.

Chicken Tikka Masala: watery, tastes like tomato sauce
Baigan Bharta: watery and tangy

I think the place was out of butter and cream or something ... I'm bummed b/c it's so close to UCSF, but I won't be going back.
author: Anvy A.

description:
if you want great indian food then come here. portions are good but not big like some other indian places. 
prices are good and you MUST have their chai tea ( comes free with your meal)
author: Diana s.

description:
Honestly, I'm stunned that people are giving this place such high scores.  This was easily the worst indian food in the city of San Francisco. I'm a big indian food eater - at least once a week. My boyfriend and I ordered the chicken tikka masala and the lamb korma and both were bland, bland bland. 

Indian food when done well is a mini explosion of flavor in your mouth - both our dishes were watery and about as flavorful as a can of Campbell's soup. I'll never go back there again.
author: N J.

description: Okay, so the food isn't amazing or anything.  It's a bit heavy on the cream, lightly spiced, and the portions are about average sized.  However, there's something about the place that makes me give it a 4.  My wife and I know the owners so that doesn't hurt.  It's conveniently located near UCSF so that doesn't hurt either.  More than anything, it's like a warm, beacon of light on a cold, foggy evening in the Sunset which is making me give this place a higher rating.  Judah can be a pretty desolate street in some places and it's nice to not have to go out of your way (I know I know, Irving is only a block away) to grab a decent meal on your way home.
author: AZ A.

description:
Small, fast, fairly inexpensive, and very tasty Indian cuisine. 

This place is perfect for a low key meal. The service is generally friendly and the food is always tasty and fresh.

I give this place a 4.5 because parking is no fun (not their fault but still) and they forgot an order of rice we paid for and once we requested it they tried to charge us again. 

Definitely not a place to take anyone you want to impress but for some good Indian food I highly recommend this place. 

P.S. If you're standing in line at Naan n' Curry right down the street, you might as well walk the extra block and save your time and money..
author: Emily H.

description: Simple and delicious.  I had the vegetable masala with a side of rice and had not problem eating the whole thing :)   And free chai is a huge plus.
author: Katie M.

description: Cheap and cheerful, wins in my book. We always get the Chicken Tikka Masala and plain naan. Best $20 dinner for 2. Free chai, too, done and done.
author: Sital P.

description:
My opinion of the place has greatly changed. It has gone from a place that is convenient and close by to a place I would drive 30 minutes just to get to. 
First thing. The staff. Can you say Amazing!! Always helpful. Always friendly. Always get your orders correct. 
Second thing. The Food. Always on time. Always hot. Always PERFECT!
Third.... This place is fast. I call in my order, walk 3 blocks and its ready. 

I eat here about once a week. It is something I look forward to. I have even been ordering it on nights where my friends come over instead of going out or cooking. Its just that good.
author: Wes P.

description:
I have yet to actually eat a meal AT Tikka Masala, but when I want a tasty take-out dinner, this is always my go-to spot. The staff has always been friendly and my order is usually ready in about 10 minutes.

I noticed that a couple of dishes that I've enjoyed in other Indian restaurants are missing from Tikka Masala's menu, but this has given me a chance to try new ones. I highly recommend the chana masala but be warned as it is very spicy! The prices are very reasonable so you can add naan and samosas to your meal.

I wish this restaurant offered more seating and a better atmosphere for sit down dinners, but for take out in Inner Sunset, it can't be beat.
author: Kay K.

description:
Great Indian/Pakistani food.
Portion size is ok, sometimes even shareable. Good amount of spiciness just as requested. Meat could be a bit chewy at times, depends on what you order but not too much bones in it. Overall not a bad place for a lunch or an occasional dinner.
Do they deliver? I never saw any fliers from them on my door or mailbox, probably would be nice to promote business to locals.
Keep up with what you're doing.
Favorite dishes: Tikka Massala, Lamb okra (bhindi goshdt?)
author: Andy M.

description:
The chicken vindaloo was way too oily. There was about 1/4 of oil above the curry (in the to-go-box) and the chicken was difficult to get off the bone. More bone than chicken. Nonetheless, it tasted okay. 

I give them an extra star for being generous with the garlic naan - they gave me 2 more than I ordered without charging extra.
author: Audrey L.

description:
I am regretful that I wasted my money at this Indian/Pakistani pit stop in the Haight. The interior looked awkward, but the chef's special Fish Masala seemed like a great choice. I added garlic naan to my order. 

Upon paying $12 (for what?), the clerk at the register didn't have enough change and mentioned he'll come back with my $5 bill. As I waited at the table, I started wondering about my money, and whether it was wise to trust him. Meanwhile, a very dry salad came out with no dressing and no silverware. By this time my opinion of the place totally went South, and I declared that it was a $12 loss for the evening. I kept waiting and waiting for my missing $5, even after the clerk returned to the front. I finally had to go up and ask him about my $5 he still owed me. He gave me a blank face for a second, then said "Oh oh, here you go." 

What. Theee. Fuck. 

The silverware came out finally, followed by the "special" fish masala. While the sauce and naan were quite tasty together, the fish sported some dark and bony spots-- a sign of a bad fillet job. I kept biting and gnawing into the dense coriander, which certainly doesn't taste good in full force. I also kept finding fragments of bone and bay leaves in the sauce, as well as a few fibrous strands of something or other. It's easy to pull out entire leaves, but not when they're fragmented throughout the sauce. I then noticed that half of the naan was over-cooked, but by that time I had lost my appetite. 

Unimpressive and regrettable. Plenty of other fine Indian sit-downs in the city will easily send this Masala shack to its fate. Oh what's that? "Don't base your rating on just one visit," you say? Well I might as well, since I won't be coming back!
author: Daniel C.

description:
I needed to satisfy an Indian Food craving I've had for weeks.

I needed a Tikka Masala Fix.

This past Friday, Cheryl D. said she was up for Indian food, too, but I told her I didn't care what restaurant as long is was cheap.  We decided on Naan n' Curry.

Got to Irving Street and there was no freakin' parking. So I suggested Tikka Masala up on Judah and we found parking near there.

Walked in and thought it seemed way cleaner than Naan n' Curry.

I was anxious for my Chicken Tikka Masala so I ordered it. 

But it didn't fulfill my Tikka Masala craving.  There wasn't enough yogurt or whatever it is that makes it creamy. The naan was delicious. But I didn't care for the Tikka Masala. I was bummed.
author: Anne M.

description: Great Indian food at very reasonable prices. The Chicken Tikki Misala and Naan are must gets!
author: Michelle G.

description:
this place is just not that great, the taste of the food is hardly authentic.. but as others said it's cheap (and you get what you pay for)

youre far better off going to star india on the other side of the park..
author: Alison T.

description:
Better than Naan and Curry, and also better than Tasty Curry  (all in the immediate neighborhood), I love this little hole in the wall.  Place is clean and well lit.  Note the CLEAN mention.  They got a 99 score from the board of health.  It's hanging right by the cash register.

 The chef Ash used to make curry in Hollywood, which is why he has all those signed pics of Farrah Fawcett and stuff around.  Ash worked at Shalimar briefly, and the other chef worked at Shalimar for a while.  Good friendly management and staff.  One thing you'll note for all the dishes is that you'll find whole herbs/spices everywhere.  And I think it makes everything taste more fresh.

Their chicken tikka masala is very tasty--a unique spice combination I think--a lot different from other places, with a perfect balance of cream and tomato, unlike most places that are just too creamy. 

I also like their Quails tikka masala that is even less creamy than the chicken tikka masala.  great balance for the stronger quail flavor.  Tandoori chicken leg is only like $3 per LEG.  

Lots of specials you don't see elsewhere.  including a chicken jerrafy (?) and beef jerrafy (not sure if I wrote that right).  Very spicy hot dish with bell peppers and hot peppers.  Perfect thing to warm you up on a cold foggy sunset evening.

Can't remember which other dishes I usually get, but Ash has some talent with this balance of spices.  Good all around, fast, and not too expensive.  The lamb chop is kinda the exception--it's good, but not as good as shalimar, and you only get 2 pieces.

Anyways, with this place so close to my apt, I usually don't need to go to the Tenderloin for my indian curry fix.

THIS PLACE RULEZ
author: Fong L.

description: They had a big selection of food which is always a good thing :). Getting water/chai tea/ordering/seating is all self serve. The restaurant is pretty small and it was cold inside which is not cool during the winter time. I wanted to just take the food togo but I was eating with family. The food was good but it took about 20 min for the food to come out when we were the only customers in there...They gave 5 pieces of nan, which was good and tasty :). I give it four stars because the food took a long time, my food was cold, and it was cold inside evvn with the doors closed..
author: Sophia I.

description:
Better than, Nan and Curry any given day.
Ok now that I've given my 2 cent, lets get rolling with the real review.

They have excellent Chicken biriyani, (with potatoes!!!!) oh what I wont to do for potatoes.  And surprisingly (unlike most indian restaurants) they also do a great rendition of vegetable biriyani.

I like their chicken Tikka Masala (name sake dish), which has a great sauce, but chicken can occasionally be on the dry side.

Occasionally they also have black-eyed-peas dish called "lobia", which is excellent, if you grew up in US, with eating the southern style baked/black-eyed-peas than you will be in for a pleasent surprise. Its darn good, although I would recommend calling the retaurant to confirm before you show up expecting it. They only do it occasionally.
Which is a shame, I have taken it upon my self to educate the ignorant masses on the goodness of indian style black-eyed peas, so that restaurant can be more frequent in cooking it. The chef/owner told me that if I call a day in advance they will make it for me.

last but not least, their aloo naan (naan bread stuffed with spicy potato filling) is excellent. Their aloo naan rivals that of Shalimar, there I said it, I'm not claiming one is better than the other, but they both are right up there.

prices are excellent, and I would recommend stopping by the liquor store across the street and picking up a bottle of wine/6-pk beer and say hello to the chatty Lady from Turkey. if you have been nice, then she might even reward you with little sweet nibbly.
author: An u.

description:
I've had a lot of tikka masala in my life, and I've had a lot of BAD tikka masala. This place is horrible. Their signature dish is the Chicken Tikka Masala, which is really acidic and tastes like tomato sauce. Their naan is ok, but other than that its not really worth it. 

Their lamb vindaloo tastes a bit better, but still the food here is very tomato-y and not at all spicy.

Everything is self serve, but the waiter was nice enough.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
This place used to be the best deal in town until they opened a new franchise in the Haight and jacked their prices up 30% overnight!!!  Are you kidding me?!?  I walk in the other day for a CTM with rice and pull $7.05 out of my pocket and the cashier says "$9."  Come again?  It looks like Tasty Curry just took back the Inner Sunset indian food crown.  At least they had the decency to go up by 25 and 50 cent increments over the span of years.
PS  Not to mention that my friend recently found a screw in his palak paneer and all they could say was "sorry,"...this place is going downhill fast.
author: Kelan T.

description:
This place is horrible.  If you like Naan-Curry and Shalimar, you will be disappointed here because I was DISAPPOINTED. 

Chicken Karahi - it is not spicy enough. It does not have much taste compared to the other Chicken Karahi I have had at Shalimar which is oily but still very flavorful.  

Bindi - Okra - It is so mushy and acidic! Very tomatoey and it doesnt even taste good!!

Aloo Naan- Thick and horrible.
author: Jboogie L.

description:
This place is awful!
I can't believe people are giving this place 4 and 5 stars.
The food here is terrible! Sure it is cheap, but there are plenty of other good Indian restaurants in SF that are just as inexpensive. 
I ordered delivery for 15-20 people. The delivery men met me in front of my building 15 minutes late (they were driving a Lexus...nicest delivery car I've ever seen), and wouldn't even help me up the stairs to my little cart. They were really jerks.
Also, their palak paneer squeaks when you chew on it. Yuck.
author: Debbie R.

description:
Have been here a number of times since I live in the neighborhood. For the most part, the food is good, and sometimes great - I think it depends on who is cooking, how busy they are, and time of day. 

The  chicken tandoori is a great deal - and I have not been disappointed. The saag paneer and chana masala are also quite good, and their garlic/basil naan is excellent. On the other hand, I am not impressed by the samosas.  Service is responsive, and the manager on duty is friendly.

Overall, it rates up there with Naan N' Curry in the Inner Sunset for Indian food. But the smaller (quieter) environment is a plus.
author: MandS R.

description: Ordered Tikka Masala and Garlic Nan bread. Both were very tasty! Not the best Tikka Masala I ever had, but a little over average I would say. Good prices :) Will definitely go back!
author: Kirsti N.

description:
Lived in the area when this place opened...

This place gets two out of its four stars for the quail masala.  Where else in the inner sunset can you get that? Honestly, though - if I want something else I go to Tasty Curry.
author: Audrey C.

description: Faisal has become a good friend, so it's hard for me to be completely impartial, but Curry Village moved in nearby and has really raised the bar.  That said, Tikka Masala is still my general go-to place for Indian in the neighborhood, and for the value it can't be beat!
author: Ari M.

description:
I wandered in here on a Monday afternoon just after the lunch rush at about 1:30 pm.  Nobody was in there eating.  I was just going to have a bit of Chappati and/or Naan to go, but then decided let's give this place a try so I sat down and ordered Vegetable Biryani, plus the Naan and Chappati.  

First off, the cashier/manager didn't offer me any water.  Even though nobody else was in the place, he seemed preoccupied with a phone call. 

Nevertheless, I sat down and waited for the food. It arrived quickly. The Chappati and Naan were fresh from the oven hot.  A bit burnt and on the thin side but okay.   The Briyani was not too spicy but the portion was small considering the $6.99 price for one order.

In fact, most of the prices seemed high on the menu for their dishes.  Especially, considering I could have gone to the Star India place on Geary @ 2nd Ave. and gotten a full all-you-can eat buffet special for $7.97.

Suffice to say service wasn't great but food tasted good.  Granted when you're hungry just about anything you eat tastes good!
author: Ed M.

description:
We've ordered from this place 3 times now,and will tell you that tonight was our last time. The first time we ordered a couple of months ago,the food was "nice" and it was tasty. Because we don't like our Indian to be too hot,one this one occasion it was mild and edible.

The last time we ordered - the food was far too spicy for what they said was "mild." We had ordered a few extra  items and after they delivered, we didn't get them.Very disappointing.

Tonight - it was,quite literally the shits.

Our "mild" food was soo hot,we could barely eat it (in between pounding down liters of water and adding yogurt and sour cream to try to take the spiciness out of our curry) I'm talking tears...our 4 year old daughter had to miss out too,so I was sifting through the pantry to see what was left for her.I'm pissed.

The papadums were stale and half burnt, the extra order of rice we had ordered did not arrive (again) and the food was extremely average.

My husband called the manager at one of the other stores who said he "bagged" our order and came across as rude,ignorant and not the kind of person who was trying to help the customer. 

I'm so pissed I can't tell you - paying money for food that was inedible - the order that was wrong (again) and an incompetent manger on duty.

This place sucks and we will now be telling all our friends not to order here after our 3 miserable attempts. 

(Oh,the one star was for our driver who was polite - this place,in our experiences isn't worth one)
author: Monique H.

description:
may not meet fancy people's needs, but the food is consistent and very very good.  we always would go when we were dating (now go for our wedding anniversary) when we lived nearby.  the owners have been the nicest coolest guys for years.  
the prices are low, the food is excellently flavored and the portions are great.  if you are there to enjoy amazing food with company you care for, you will be more than happy.
author: ed h.

description: Very impressed with this place! The prices  were super reasonable. Chicken Tikka Masala was about $7.50. I shared it with my wife along with rice for lunch and we were both satisfied. Naan was good. They gave us chai tea for free. The restaurant was clean enough. I will definitely go back. Great for lunch!
author: Daniel B.

description: My husband and I went there for the first time last night.  Being from England, he's very picky about his Indian food.  The food was great, mild for me, spicy for him.  It's small, and not fancy, but who cares when the food is this good!
author: Tess H.

description:
This place is definitely more useful as a take out option than dine in.  I went here with my GF to satisfy an overwhelming urge to choke down some naan & lentils and we opted to eat in the establishment.  They were busier than usual and seemed ill prepared for it, there wasn't even glasses of water for us but the owners were nice people and the wife brought out our food fast.  As I mentioned i wanted lentils and it was a nice addition to the spicy vegi rice.  It was a bit awkward when I asked for the check and they gave us milk tea as a parting gift but eh, it was OK.  They wanted to make sure we left happy and that is what matters in this heartless world.  They give you enough good food to make a meal out of it the next day so I would recommend anyone interested to come here for good take out.

CONCLUSION: What the fuck is wrong with me?  The financial world decays your soul.
author: ray M.

description: Cheap food. Love the naan especially the cheese ones. Always love the chicken tikka Marsala. Small joint though so sometimes hard to get a table. One thing I do like is the free chai tea.
author: Darren C.

description:
I could have given a 5, but needs a little more cleanliness. Food is great for a very reasonable price. 

Tikka masala, naan are great.  Free Tea.
author: Shadow L.

description: Good. Almost forgot my kabob but offered rice or nan to accompany it since we'd finished everything else. Will come back for sure.
author: Michael K.

description: This is a gem in San Francisco. Cheap and Yummy Indian food with the best naan I have found around. The sizes are on the smaller size but perfect for one person or order a few dishes for more people.
author: Melinda Q.

description:
99 out of 100 rating from the Board of Health. That's worth something in an indian place.

OK everything i've had here has been REALLY good- but it hasn't knocked my socks off. for that and the high health rating, i give it 4 stars.
author: Rich V.

description:
i thought the food was pretty decent here. i would say its a tiny step up from naan n curry down the street. 

now im not an indian cuisines expert, i wouldnt know curry hill from murray hill, or wait, are those the same thing? i digress....

yeah the garlic naan was, well,  garlicy, nice crispy and fluffy garlicy goodness......... i loved their  *WARNING VERY HOT* sauce. just a dab of it and it made all the other sauce have a nice, FLAVORFUL, kick.

i was really surprised with the FLYING HORSE indian beer. very good. id say a mix of korean water (hite) and a lager with actual flavor. 

BUT WTF, the water tasted like the funk. STAY AWAY FROM THE WATER..... 

just drink the flying horse beer and things will be alright.
author: Euge L.

description: When it's a Tikka Night, it usually means one thing and one thing only: Big test tomorrow.  Yes the classmates and I have had many "last meals" here because 1) it's just 3 blocks from the library and 2) chai tea is just the perfect pick-me-up for a long night of studying all things physical therapy, and you get all you want there.  Other than that I don't really see why I'd come here over Naan N Curry.
author: William S.

description:
lamb shank (not on menu)
ground beef dish (not on menu)
potato naan
coolest owner ever
all the cab drivers in the city eat here for a reason

1 star cuz you're too cheap to hit the $25 delivery minimum? thats why you cant trust yelp sometimes
author: Wats C.

description: We happened to stumble upon this place after originally planning to go to Lavash on Irving, but it just so happened to be closed on Mondays. I've been in an Indian/Pakistani kind of mood ever since trying Punjabi Tandoor in SD, so we wanted some good masala. Compared to the other masala I had, the one at this place is just okay. The curry is actually pretty good and reminds me of tomato bisque, but they are pretty stingy with the chicken pieces (I only got like five pieces). And on top of that, the chicken was really really dry. But I did enjoy the samosas, which had two sauces: one was a sweet cranberry like sauce and the other was a mint sauce. The garlic and basil naan didn't have that much extra flavor than the regular naan. The sizes were also a lot smaller than the ones I'm used to. They had free chai tea, but it tasted pretty watered down. If I wanted this quality food for the price I was paying, I probably would have gone to Naan N' Curry a few blocks away. But at least the daal is semi-decent and tasted healthy with the roti.
author: Bailey Z.

description:
Ordered takeout and the food was horrible. The garlic naan was like white bread with garlic powder sprinkled on top. The samosas were undercooked. The chutney, watery and lacked flavor. The okra was undercooked and chewy. The chicken jalfraze was mediocre but at least edible. Avoid this place if you like actual Indian food, not something worse than a Tasty Bite packet.

The only saving grace: They were friendly on the phone when we ordered.
author: Matt H.

description: This is for the Judah location - the downtown (Ellis) place is a disgrace. I think I like this place because it seems to be completely disorganized - diners rooting around for silverware, the chai never put out on time, servers have no idea where the orders go. All of it adds up to a kind of endearing chaos. I have always gotten a first-rate meal here.
author: George S.

description: Really all that needs to be said about this place is lack of flavor....
author: Srinivas R.

description: Naan n Curry has nothing on this hole in the wall, its small, cheap, good, fast, and self serve
author: Doug D.

description: mixed results tonight. quail tandoori had great flavor. daal was very bland and very disappointing. I ordered the signature dish chicken tiki masala and it never came. the chicken biyrani was average and the chicken tasted like wood.  still curious about the tikki masala though. let's see what happens on the return visit.
author: Jeff W.

description: i can't believe i had to go here again. i don't think i have ever had worse indian food. i'm not even picky, but even naan n' curry was better. i wanted to avoid the chunks of bone and cartilage in the chicken saag so i got chicken tikka masala. almost no meat, floating in oily flavorless sauce. i decided to add rice to soak up some of the watery sauce, but even with a little added texture it was still super bland. and the meat was dry. there are so many good restaurants in inner sunset, never go here.
author: Alexa K.

description: Love it! Total hole in the wall which equals super yummy! Love their samosas the most and of course great chicken tikka masala!
author: Katie W.

description: The naan tastes like cardboard.  Last time I ate their I am pretty sure I ate freezer naan from Costco.  Most of the dishes have very little spice.  This place used to be ok, but since they opened up their second location, the food has gone way down hill.
author: Ryan S.

description: This place is alright. It's kinda a hole in the wall, near UCSF and isolated from the 9th Ave drag. They have free chai, which is good. The dishes aren't that expensive. I ordered the potato naan. lamb saag and chicken tikka masala. The lamb saag was good - lots of spinach. The chicken was good, but slightly dry and I felt that there was a lot of sauce compared to the amount of chicken. The service is pretty quick and usually it's not that crowded. Will go back.
author: Natalie S.

description: From my two experiences eating food from this restaurant, I'd have to say it is pretty mediocre to sub-par for Indian food. The tikka masala sauce is not thick enough so it is like chicken in hot rust colored water. The okra was really mushy and not fresh, even mushier than typical cooked-to-death-but-still-good Indian vegetables. A vindaloo dish lacked...spice. Hello? The servers are friendly though and if you are ever hospitalized at UCSF for two weeks you can get people to smuggle in something for you.
author: Jackie P.

description: I enjoyed my meal here. The owner/staff are very friendly and the atmosphere is quiet and unassuming.
author: Kathryn T.

description:
just had lunch here after a year and was not disappointed.  the chicken vindaloo was well made and the naan was pretty good as well.  the rice was a little off, tho, but with all the spice...i couldn't tell after a couple of bites. 
great for a quick lunch in the sunset. 
one problem is the people traffic inside. they make u order at the back counter and then sit and eat.  this wouldn't be a problem if the place was bigger than my bedroom, which it isn't.
author: Roy N.

description: This place is no Shalimar, but I don't care what anyone says. When I was interning at UCSF this place would always satisfy me. More than I could say about some boyfriends. Hah!
author: Jen Y.

description:
Last night was the first time I've been back to this place after a couple of years. 

The first impression was not good. I ordered a mango lassi. I took a taste and it was both watery without the proper  flavor. I brought it right back to the cashier who brought it out to me and I asked him whether it had been watered down. He told me that they make it with mango juice and milk. I told him that a Lassi is supposed to have yogurt and gave it right back to him. (When this kind of thing happens in an "ethnic" restaurant in the U.S., it almost makes me wonder whether aside from the obvious skimping, whether there is a sense of contempt for the diner who they think won't really know the difference.)

I also had the Saag Paneer (Spinach with Cheese Cubes) which was prepared quite well, a very nice balance of flavors. Additionally I had the Garlic & Basil Naan. The dough seemed to be REALLY light....any lighter and it would have floated into the upper atmosphere. Frankly, I prefer some body to it. There was some garlic and the basil used was dried basil.

Given what they did with the Lassi and the Naan, it makes me wonder if these are economy moves..which I think ultimately will turn out to be false economy.

I think that I would return here if I saw a banner that said "Under New Management."
author: Martin F.

description: I love this place - fast, cheap, good food, and good service. The guy at the register usually asks how I am and makes some jokes with me. This place scores sooooo much more over Naan & Curry on Irving - I can't take the line and that grumpy guy at the register anymore.
author: Bridget W.

description: This place rocks.  Try the Bangin Bharta, sp?  It's bangin...
author: Meghan B.

description: How this place has gotten so many high scores is beyond me.  The entrees were watery and flavorless.
author: Max F.

description:
Indian food delivered tonight was looking bleak.  The three that kept popping up in my hood got bad reviews- consistently bad- but then I found this page.  Decent enough reviews for a try so I ordered.  

This will be my go-to Indian delivery from now on.  Unfortunately the guy didn't give me a menu- I ordered off their online menu (love those).  He also didn't know the exact total of everything.  But whatevs- the food:  I ordered chicken tikka masala, palak paneer, lamb vindaloo, raita, rice and naan.  I had to order $25 worth- gotta take the good (mostly everything) with the bad (this kind of shit) when living solo.  The chicken was good but the sauce not as creamy as I like.  I think the sauce will be perfect for the prawn masala, which I will order next time.  The paneer was excellent- homemade and it tastes like they fire it in the tandoor.  The palak part was okay.  It was more like chopped greens than the mush I usually like.  Much better tho than the greens water they serve you in India.  The lamb was very tasty.  It could have been hotter- I even asked him to make sure it was spicy, to which he replied, "Lamb vindaloo is always spicy."  I said, "I know but please make it spicy."  The rest was all good as well.  

It didn't blow my mind but it was SO much better than the Indian I had delivered when I first moved here- I think it was Great India.  Pllooo.

After I put my leftovers in the fridge, I saw that I had Kingfisher beer in my fridge.  Totally forgot about it after leaving town for a week.  Awesome.  I feel so whole.
author: Staci M.

description: Not a bad experience, forgot what I had but remember it was tasty!
author: Toonces The Driving Cat K.

description: What the hell happened???? This used to me a decent dive for your Indian/Pakistani cravings, but ever since they got a fancy menu, opened up in the Haight and started delivering it is crap. They used to use quality fish in the Masala, now its crappy cheap fishy tasting tuna. I used to frequent this place every now and again, but I am done. Good Bye Forever Tikka Masala!!!!!!
author: Nikki P.

description: Great food served by very friendly staff. Relaxed environment where you never get rushed to hurry up and eat your food and get out. Generous and very tasty portions at excellent value for dollar.  My family has eaten here many times over the years and we have always been made to feel welcome with our kids. And, they are cool with tweaking the spiciness of the dishes as requested to suit personal preference.  Excellent naan as others have noted, especially good is the onion naan. Some of our favorite dishes are the saag paneer, aloo gobhi, baigan bharta, and their namesake dish, tikka masala.  Personally, I really like the chai because it is good basic brew always hot and plentiful.  As for cleanliness, a paramount concern, we have had no issues over the years.  Hey, the bathrooms are clean too.  So, bottom line, we give it a 2 thumbs up!
author: P L.

description: I don't get why people are hating on this place. It's a nice, little (very clean) hole in the wall restaurant with very good food. The staff is very friendly. They have a 99 health safety rating, so that has to count of something, right? The prices are completely reasonable too.
author: Kevin O.

description: Brought an out of town colleague here for lunch after we were done at UCSF. Service was friendly, food was good, convenient hole in the wall to stop in at. I cannot remember the names of the dishes we ordered since we ordered several but the lamb was great.
author: Mary L.

description: Their signiture dish, Chicken Tikka masala was okay, the chicken was dry but the sauce was good. The aloo gobi was better. Naan  could of been a little more favorful. Price was helpful in getting a decent rating.
author: Henry H.

description: I walk by this place all the time on my way back from the gym and it's always packed.  Tried it tonight for the first time.  The service sucked horribly (mostly due to one clueless kid) but the food was great and the prices were reasonable.  I'm Indian and am pretty picky but the palak paneer was cooked to perfection and the naan was fresh and yummy.
author: Sat Kriya K.

description: probably one of the most cost-effective reasturants out there. I have not been able to find another cheap indian resturant with their taste of chicken tikka masala. fast, cheap, tasty.
author: carmil a.

description: Love this place.  Soo close to UCSF and the food is both relatively inexpensive and tasty.  The food is fresh and of good quality.  And after my friend told me a really terrible story about Naan n Curry involving yep you guessed it cockroaches, I make this my must pit stop for indian/pakistani food.   The chicken tikka masala is also my favorite, but I haven't been disappointed with any of their dishes.  The atmosphere is extremely casual and pretty clean.
author: Michelle T.

description: If you want great Indian food in the Inner Sunset go to Masala at 9th and Irving. If you want cheap and good Indian food come here. If you want cheap, dirty and inedible go to Naan N Curry.
author: tess s.

description: mmm. cozy little hole in the wall. the waiters and who i'm assuming is the owner/cashier.. were all quite funny characters confusing each other if the dishes had been served or not.  lol. serve it yourself with water and utensils.  the tikka masala, basil naan, and a lamb dish i had was deelish! i agree with everyone else - clean and cheap! the downside being it gets a bit crowded.. as i got stuck sitting next to this snooty couple who didn't want to share a table and made faces and started complaining when they had little choice.  .. prompting me and my homegirl to be even more obnoxious and loud and make faces back. haha. it's a small place.. lighten up and enjoy the food!
author: ally o.

description: My favorite Indian restaurant in the city and probably one of the best kept secrets. The chicken tikka masala is very good. The naan is crisp in a way I don't see at most Indian places. You can tell the owners are devoted to making good food. The only reason this place isn't as successful as other Indian joints is because it's located away from the main restaurant drag in the Sunset. It's definitely better than Naan and Curry on Irving Street or any place in the Mission.
author: Hmmm W.

description: Even if the food were not stellar, at least they could have gone for the value market. But for low prices, you get small portions, overcooked chicken, stiff naan, and saag that has been sitting out forever. You get what you pay for.
author: A. T.

description: i came here with my sisters and they heard that the food was good and cheap. but they obviously lied or have not had much Indian food. i cannot say it was entirely bad. the shrimp biryani was delicious and not too spicy. but that was it. the naan (garlic and plain) was horrible! the plain had a doughy texture to it. the garlic and basil only tasted like garlic (maybe i've been spoiled but i prefer the naan with actual garlic and basil bits on them.) i always get the chicken masala at any Pakistani/Indian restaurant and i have never been so disappointed. it was bland and warm. the lamb vindaloo was never a favorite of mine anywhere. so i don't have much a review for that. if i were to try this place again it would only be for the shrimp biryani but i doubt i will be returning to this restaurant in the future.
author: Jen P.

description: i came here when they first opened.  service was slow and the guy kept getting orders mixed up etc.  i guess it's understandable since they just opened and couldn't get all the stuff right.  it was decent.  not the greatest.  i think i would walk 3 more blocks to go Naan n Curry where i can sit more comfortably.  this place is SMALL.  i haven't been back for 2 years now... i guess that tells you something.
author: Kapo T.

description: i liked this place more than its new owners. completely based on food and prices. the prices have now gone up (something no one likes) and the food is different. when i order my favorite eggplant dish, it is now mostly thick slices of onions!!! i miss it the old way :( i still come here occasionally but not as much as before.
author: Raye T.

description: This is my favorite Indian place in SF.  The spices are really good and the price is decent. My favorite dish here is the lamb anything and the spinach paneer. The bread (especially the garlic one) is tasty.
author: sam c.

description: not a hole in the wall but cozy and open til 10pm on a weeknight - in SF - YEA.  free chai and decent prices.  occasional shady characters
author: Emm C.

description: The Chicken Tikka Masala is the best in the neighborhood, the guy that works the register is about as friendly as you can get (w/o being creepy) at an Indian restaurant.  It's a small place and sometimes you have to ask them for extra cups, etc... but overall, the food is consistently good, the service is consistently friendly, and the location is consistently convenient for those that work at UCSF.  I'm a frequenter of South Asian restaurants since I'm a brown kid that can't really cook, and this food is definitely the best South Asian food in the inner sunset.
author: goph s.

description: The food was great and impossible to beat for the price, however something else dragged it down.  I love eating Indian food and after eating here, I felt like I had near food poisoning for 36 hours.  Bring your pepto bismal, you get what you pay for!
author: Andrew W.

description: I really love this place. We have gone several times and I think the flavors and freshness of the food is better than most other places we have tried in the city. My only complaint is that it is sometimes a little too spicy. My fiance and I are huge fans of spicy foods, but there have been a couple of  times that we were both crying while eating out dinner!!! Once we asked them to make it mild and it came out even spicier...must not have liked our request. Despite, I still love this place and will continue to eat here.
author: Lauren D.
